id: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Dave Wilson-Bedlam and Squalor, Upstairs, 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Dave Wilson
venue: Bedlam and Squalor, Upstairs, 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
The next concert in our series presents a new project by Dave Wilson titled Free, Free: Meditations on Liberation. This project brings together a collective of musicians from across the music communities of Pōneke in an invitation to explore the expansive possibilities for what liberation might sound like.

Free, Free draws from legacies of musical collectivity, and celebrates a commitment to both collaboration and the distinct expression of each individual.

Ranging from contemplative minimalism to ecstatic ensemble energy and body-moving grooves, the music of Free, Free invites musicians and other listeners to tend to each moment, making their own offerings to shape the collective sound.

Dave Wilson is a saxophonist, clarinettist, composer, producer, and interdisciplinary scholar. His music bridges avant-garde and experimental music with various groove-oriented styles from the worlds of jazz, R&B, electronic music, and more. With his 2023 album Ephemeral, described as “quite spiritually intense music” by The Guardian, he was a finalist for Te Manu Taki Tautito o te Tau | Best Jazz Artist at the Aotearoa Music Awards, and for the APRA Best Jazz Composition Award. Before relocating to Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington in 2016, Dave grew up in the Chicago area, lived for a decade in Los Angeles, and spent several stints living in Skopje, North Macedonia.

Free, Free: Meditations on Liberation:
Dave Wilson, Tyaan Singh – alto saxophone
Louisa Williamson – tenor saxophone
Monique Lapins, Mana Waiariki – violin
Ken Ichinose – cello
Kaito Walley, Natania Ngawhau – trombone
Ben Hunt – trumpet
Daniel Hayles, Andrew Faleatua – piano and keyboard
Phoebe Johnson – bass
Callum Allardice – guitar
Hikurangi Schaverien-Kaa – drums

The performance will begin with an opening set by Flute Journeys, an offbeat mass flute ensemble with the self-described playing abilities of 5–12-year-olds, embodying a form of liberation in music.

The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15 from Humanitix, door sales $20.

Thanks to CNZ for their generous support. See less

id: Contemporary Realism - 8 Week Painting Course-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Contemporary Realism - 8 Week Painting Course
venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
description:
Whether you work from objects, the figure, or secondary sources, this is an opportunity to explore working more loosely, using oils or acrylics.

Experienced tutor, Justine Turnbull, will guide you through drawing and painting exercises to help loosen you up, and will discuss art historical techniques that may be relevant to your individual artistic style and context.

This course will increase your ability to represent perceived objects in a dynamic, painterly way. You will be guided through drawing and painting exercises to help you achieve accuracy of form, working loosely with oils and acrylics to create fresh contemporary paintings. The emphasis is on working with your chosen source material to create a `next level’ painting. This course is for those who have explored some of the basics of painting such as mixing colours, blending etc, but want to find a process that best expresses your unique approach and ideas. Skills learnt in class can be applied across all genres.

Materials are not included in this course.
Materials: Please bring your preferred range of oils, brushes and supports (paper, canvas, or board). A good basic set of oil paints would include cad and lemon yellow, ultramarine and cerulean blue, and cad red and alizarin crimson. Also, black and white. Inverlochy will supply Liquin and odourless turps. Please also bring a photocopied reference image in both black and white and colour.

Lunch break - 30 minutes. Bring a water bottle and packed lunch to enjoy in the historic Inverlochy House or explore the local cafes in Te Aro.

Thursdays, 9:30 - 3 pm.
24 July - 11 September.

id: Shostakovich Unpacked | NZSQ + Antipodes Quartet-Prefab Hall, 14 Jessie St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Shostakovich Unpacked | NZSQ + Antipodes Quartet
venue: Prefab Hall, 14 Jessie St, Wellington
description:
Introducing Shostakovich: Unpacked. A four-part concert series presented by New Zealand String Quartet and friends to commemorate the 50th anniversary of Shostakovich’s death.
Across four night-time gatherings, the NZSQ will take to the stage with Orchestra Wellington, Antipodes Quartet, Ghost Trio, and pianist Jian Liu to explore the raw emotional power of one of the 20th century’s most troubled, yet defiant, musical voices.
Each concert features a specially curated selection of the chamber music of Shostakovich, paired with the unique voices of Aotearoa composers. From duets, to quartets, to a full chamber orchestra, we're getting up close to the celebrated chamber music and lasting legacy of Dimitri Shostakovich, 50 years after his death.
We invite you to join us on the journey of “Shostakovich: UNPACKED”, as together we explore and question what this powerful music meant in the time Shostakovich wrote it, but also how vitally important the composer’s artistic voice still is today.
Concert Two: Wednesday 6 August, 6:30pm, NZSQ x Antipodes Quartet
Artists onstage: NZSQ / Antipodes Quartet
Shostakovich: 6th and 7th String Quartets, String Octet
Unpacked: The music of Gao Ping
Spotlight: Be part of Aotearoa’s musical history, as the first chapter of the newly formed Antipodes Quartet unfolds in their Wellington debut. Created as part of a visionary new partnership between NZSQ, Chamber Music New Zealand, and the Adam Chamber Music Festival, the next generation of leading chamber musicians step forward; two string quartets artistically colliding, joining forces to perform Shostakovich’s gripping octet.
Tickets: $15 - $55, or get a season pass to all four concerts for $180 per person
Season pass discount will be automatically applied at checkout when you have one 'Season Pass' ticket per person, per concert date in your cart.
In order:
Wednesday 9 July, 6:30pm & 8:30pm, NZSQ + Orchestra Wellington
Wednesday 6 August, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Antipodes Quartet
Wednesday 1 October, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Ghost Trio
Tuesday 25 November, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Jian Liu

id: Qi Gong-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Qi Gong
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Qi gong, pronounced “chi gong,” was developed in China thousands of years ago as part of traditional Chinese medicine. It involves using exercises to optimize energy within the body, mind, and spirit, with the goal of improving and maintaining health and well-being.

Qigong has both psychological and physical components and involves the regulation of the mind, breath, and body’s movement and posture.

In most forms of qigong:

Breath is slow, long, and deep. Breath patterns may switch from abdominal breathing to breathing combined with speech sounds.
Movements are typically gentle and smooth, aimed for relaxation.
Mind regulation includes focusing one’s attention and visualization.
Dynamic (active) qigong techniques primarily focus on body movements, especially movements of the whole body or arms and legs. Meditative (passive) qigong techniques can be practiced in any posture that can be maintained over time and involve breath and mind exercises, with almost no body movement.
Wear loose, comfortable clothing and bring a bottle of water.

[This is a physical activity that involves an element of risk. While all possible measures are taken to prevent accidents or injury, please note that participation is at your own risk].

Duration 6 weeks

id: Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell Quintet-The Cavern Club, 22 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell Quintet
venue: The Cavern Club, 22 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
The Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell Quintet is thrilled to be performing at the WJC!

Led by saxophonist Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell, the group features Henry Sherris on trumpet —
reuniting after a five-year break during which Henry honed his craft in New York. The two first
played together as teenagers in the Young Musicians Program under the mentorship of the
legendary Rodger Fox, and now return to the stage for this special performance.

Joining them are Callum Allardice on guitar, Seth Boy on bass, and Abe Baillie on drums — an
exceptional rhythm section known for their deep musical connection and expressive interplay.

The quintet will perform a dynamic mix of original jazz compositions. Each piece reflects
moments from Nicholas’s recent journey — from touring internationally with the Rodger Fox Big
Band to day-to-day insights gained through his work as a teacher. The set will also feature
compositions by Henry, offering reflections on his time living and studying in New York.

This concert marks a meaningful farewell before Nicholas heads to Amsterdam to begin the
next chapter of his musical journey. Don’t miss the chance to experience this heartfelt
performance live.

id: Intro to Acrylic Painting - 8 week course-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Intro to Acrylic Painting - 8 week course
venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
description:
This is a foundational class that will enable you to make a painting of your choice! The course is open to people of any level of experience.

Bring in a reference or set up a still life and we will deconstruct how to paint it. You will leave with paintings as well as a toolbox for breaking any subject matter down into simple steps. Personalised tutor feedback will help you refine your skills and develop a unique style. At the beginning of each class there will be a practical demonstration.

Throughout the term we will cover the following:

- Materials and equipment
- Preparing the ground
- Designing the composition
- Colour relationships, warm and cool, colour mixing
- How to simplify the major shadows
- Subtleties of the mid tones
- Highlights, and other finishing touches
- When to stop painting (important!)
- Realism and style

Basic materials included. Students must be at least 18 years of age to attend this course.

Thursday evenings, 6 - 8 pm.
24 July - 11 September.

id: Kāpiti Chorale presents: Wellington Composers-St Paul's Church, 1 Langdale Ave, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
name: Kāpiti Chorale presents: Wellington Composers
venue: St Paul's Church, 1 Langdale Ave, Paraparaumu
description:
This concert features music from right here in our region, and we believe these works could stand on any stage. We’re performing pieces by composers, arrangers, and lyricists from the wider Wellington area whose work deserves to be heard more often.

We begin with tributes to two influential figures we’ve lost: Jenny McLeod and lyricist Shirley Murray. Then we move into works by people we’ve sung with, worked with, and deeply admire. Rosemary Russell contributes three pieces. Jonathan Berkahn, who played organ at our last concert, has two featured works: a Nunc Dimittis and Magnificat.

Cadence Chung, recipient of our 2023 Kāpiti Chorale Performance Award, returns to sing with us, this time performing her own composition for voice, flute, and piano, as well as joining the choir for other pieces. We're glad to have her back.

Our director Eric Sidoti brings a new arrangement of a song by Six60, adding a fresh and familiar note to the evening.

We’ll close with Mass in E Minor by Thomas Nikora, another musician we’ve had the pleasure of working with. Thomas sang in the choir at a previous concert and has accompanied some of our rehearsals, and now we’re performing his Mass with the largest choir to present it to date. It’s a bold, expressive work that shows the depth and versatility of a composer equally at home performing, conducting, and writing music. We’re proud to be singing it.

Join us on Saturday 9 August at 4 PM at St Paul’s Church, Paraparaumu.
This concert starts one hour later than usual. Bring a friend, enjoy a winter afternoon of music, and help us fill the church. These are works we believe in, and we can’t wait to share them with you.

Music Director: Eric Sidoti
Assistant Music Director: Ann-Marie Stapp
Soprano Solo: Cadence Chung
Flute: Malu Jonas
Piano: Phillip O’Malley

Date: Saturday 9 August 2025
Time: 4:00 PM
Venue: St Paul’s Church, Kapiti Road, Paraparaumu

Printed tickets will soon be available from Moby Dickens’ (Paraparaumu Beach), Jenoa (Waikanae), and Books & Co (Ōtaki), or by emailing tickets@kapitichorale.org.nz or calling (021) 261 2749.

id: Princess Chelsea's Midwinter Ball-Meow Nui, 92 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington, 6011, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Princess Chelsea's Midwinter Ball
venue: Meow Nui, 92 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington, 6011, Wellington
description:
PRINCESS CHELSEA’S MIDWINTER BALL
SWORDS AND SORCERY - Fantasy on The Big Screen
with your host TOM SAINSBURY

SATURDAY 19 JULY - WINTERGARDEN, THE CIVIC, AUCKLAND (ALL AGES) *
SATURDAY 26 JULY - MEOW NUI, WELLINGTON **

With special guests THE CIRCLING SUN & GOLDEN AXE *
GRECCO ROMANK & LUKE BUDA **

‘The Wintergarden will host many, many more incredible events, but it will never host something like the mesmerising Princess Chelsea and Twin Peaks crossover again’ - Rolling Stone

This winter, the Civic Wintergarden (ALL AGES) and Meow Nui (18+) Wellington will be transformed into a world of fantasy! Princess Chelsea’s Midwinter Ball returns, this year with a new theme: SWORDS AND SORCERY - Fantasy on The Big Screen. With your esteemed host comedian Tom Sainsbury, and live performances from Princess Chelsea & The Dream Warriors in both centres, with Auckland guests The Circling Sun & Golden Axe, while Wellington will be treated to sets from Grecco Romank & Luke Buda.

In the shimmering and VHS-heavy age of the early 1980s, a treasure trove of cinematic fantasy was thrust upon us. Gleaming swords and potent spells in Excalibur, the ethereal beauty and terror of Legend, valiant quests of The Sword and The Sorcerer, Ladyhawke, The Beastmaster, Willow, Dragonslayer, and the mighty & muscular quests of Conan The Barbarian. And let us not forget the timeless enchantments of pure fantasy with The Neverending Story, the delightful Princess Bride, the poignant Last Unicorn, and the unforgettable shape of Labyrinth.

So, brave adventurers, will you join us to celebrate this golden age? How will you dress to impress as visions of enchanted lands and heroic feats conjure a costume fit for fantasy?

Called by many as ‘the show of 2024’, last year’s Twin Peaks themed Midwinter Ball was a revelation, and a dress up party for the ages. A sold out Wintergarden heaved with 650 guests dressed as Log Ladies, Agent Dale Coopers, and even a giant slice of cherry pie… and oh, so much more.

Princess Chelsea and her band The Dream Warriors delighted the audience with a blazing set of originals alongside covers of Julee Cruise, Angelo Badalamenti and In Heaven from Lynch’s Eraserhead. This wild and unforgettable night has been lovingly captured and presented as a four song tribute to David Lynch, due for imminent release.
For 2024’s Twin Peaks-themed ball, no expenses were spared on transforming the venue into the quaint town of Twin Peaks. Decoration which featured lasers, an indoor pine forest, a shrine to Laura Palmer and a replica of the infamous Red Room, we can only expect magic and mystery from 2025’s fantasy- themed ball.

“I’m not giving too much away but obviously we will need a medieval sword fight” - Princess Chelsea

If last year’s ball was anything to go by, I don't think she is joking - and further shenanigans will undoubtedly ensue. Expect the Civic and Meow Nui to be transformed into a world of fantasy.

Earlybird tickets are on sale Friday at 10am. Book your evening, and swan down the red carpet dressed in your favourite fantasy-inspired outfits. Portraits will be taken on the night, and prizes for best dressed.

description:
Join Afro-Kiwi artist InDuna to celebrate the release of his brand new EP, ‘Go High’, live at Moon, Wellington on Saturday 2nd August.

‘Go High’ is a gift from InDuna’s younger self to the artist he is today. It's an uplifting and reflective Afro-pop project inspired by his South African roots and journey of resilience. The EP is a reminder to keep dreaming boldly, no matter the obstacles.

Doors open: 9:00 PM
Show starts: 9:30 PM

Venue: Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Newtown, Wellington
Moon is a wheelchair-accessible venue with both seated and standing options available.

When the NFC ticket bundle is purchased, fans will get exclusive access to a limited edition NFC-enabled EP, featuring the full EP plus unreleased demos and future tracks, delivered directly to your device before they’re available anywhere else. InDuna merchandise will also be available on the night — don’t miss it.

About InDuna:
Self-taught artist and producer InDuna blends Afro-pop with the vibrant spirit of his South African heritage. He was recently honoured with the Young Global Achiever Award at the 2024 Prince’s Trust Awards in London and recognised at Buckingham Palace by King Charles III.

His music has reached global ears, with his track ‘Dreams’, written for the documentary Ink and Gold: An Artist’s Journey to Olympic Glory, winning Best Original Song at the International Online Web Fest and climbing to #6 on the NZ Hot Singles Chart.

id: Natural Texture Earrings and Pendants-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Natural Texture Earrings and Pendants
venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
description:
A quick taster class that’s ideal as a weekend outing for friends, or as a treat for you! In three short hours, learn to craft an amazing pair of textured metal earrings - from scratch!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. After completing this class, you will have one pair of beautiful earrings to wear away or gift to someone special!

You will practice on smaller texture samples to work out what texture and what metal you want to go with, and then move on to creating your earrings in warm copper, yellow brass and sterling silver - with solid sterling silver earring hooks or posts.

Your class materials pack includes everything you need for the class to make a super cool pair of beautiful earrings. You are welcome to purchase extra materials for larger pieces at the studio.

We use quality pre-made sterling silver earring wires, or earring posts with silicone stud backs for these taster classes so that you can focus on making the main part of the earrings and know that your findings will be just perfect.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but an enrolled parent or caregiver must accompany anyone under the age of 16.

id: The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder

venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos
Transform the exhausting cycle of mental loops, rumination, and decision paralysis into mental clarity and peace.

This 60-minute workshop will give you practical tools to break the cycle. You'll discover why your brain fixates on worry, how to interrupt rumination before it spirals, and master simple techniques that create instant mental clarity. Walk away with a proven system based on FasterEFT for transforming your overthinking patterns into inner peace, so you can finally quiet the noise and reclaim control of your mind.

Plus, your ticket includes a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert—because taking care of your mind is best supported by feeding your body well.

Meet Krishnaloka, your host

Introducing Krishnaloka, who is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology. As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.

id: D. H. Lawrence's The Fox-Gryphon Theatre, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
name: D. H. Lawrence's The Fox
venue: Gryphon Theatre, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Premiere production of D.H.Lawrence’s The Fox adapted for the stage by Keith Scott, Dunedin playwright. Directed by Annabel Hensley

It is 1918, immediately after the armistice which ended the Great War. Two women struggle to run a small farm in rural England and are moderately content. Their comfortable, albeit unfulfilling lives, are disrupted by two visitors. A fox has begun to take their hens and a young soldier arrives. These seemingly unrelated events combine and clash with unexpected consequences. The play explores the dynamics of power play when instincts are triggered that are as old as life itself.

The play explores gender roles, sexuality, femininity, and the pity of war, with Scott’s adaptation maintaining the authenticity of Lawrence’s original work.

id: The Inner Magnet: Attracting Inner Well-Being-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder

venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars

We all seek deeper fulfillment and lasting happiness. In this workshop, discover how to attract the life satisfaction you’ve been craving by tuning into desires that align with your true self. Through practical insights and timeless yoga wisdom, we’ll explore how to create a life based on what truly nourishes you. Join us to unlock the power of your inner magnet and create lasting transformation.

Meet your host, Sivananda

Sivananda’s background is in both science and music, holding a Master's Degree in Data Science, a Bachelor of Science in Physics and a long history of playing and performing on the double bass. His passion for philosophy, music, good food and community attracted him to the bhakti lifestyle. Having studied and practiced the science of the ‘self’ for six years now, he thrives on drawing insights from contemporary science and combining it with yoga wisdom to encourage others to explore new perspectives.

id: Planting and Track Maintenance - Working Bee-Manawa Karioi Reserve, Danube Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Planting and Track Maintenance - Working Bee
venue: Manawa Karioi Reserve, Danube Street, Wellington
description:
Our track maintenance and planting working bees are focussing on plant species diversity rather than large planting quantities. We have ordered 500 special trees from the Berhampore Nursery. We are in this for the long haul and a forest that contains a wide range of plant species will, in turn, attract a wider range of birds, lizards, and invertebrates. A wider range of plant species also allows for the forest to naturally regenerate and helps prevent weed species from establishing.

Tools are provided, bring sturdy shoes and a water bottle, Working bees are held every Sunday in June (except June 1st - Kings Birthday Weekend) and August 2025.

Meeting at the Information Shelter in the Tapu te Ranga car park at the end of Danube Street in Island Bay. Children are welcome with parents or guardians.

id: Yoga Nidra-Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington-Event Finder
name: Yoga Nidra
venue: Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington
description:
Join us on the first Friday of every month at to AWHI yourself with a 90-minute Yoga Nidra. Unwind from the stresses of the week and the month in a state of relaxation. Yoga Nidra, often referred to as "yogic sleep," is a deeply restorative practice that promotes physical relaxation, mental clarity, and emotional balance. It's the perfect way to rejuvenate your mind, body, and soul: your hinengaro, tinana and wairua.

Yoga Nidra is a powerful technique that directly works to heal your mind by removing samskaras - untying knots and mental impressions. This practice of learning to relax consciously is well regarded as an antidote for stress, anxiety, poor sleep amongst other health benefits.

What to Expect:
- A 90-minute guided Yoga Nidra Meditation led by one of our experienced instructors
- A comfortable space to lie down (mats, blankets, bolsters & cushions provided)
- A supportive community of fellow meditation enthusiasts
- Complementary herbal tea before/after the session;
- An opportunity to journal your experience, if desired
- A chance to destress and cultivate inner calm

Yoga Nidra is for everyone and no prior experience is required - everyone is welcome to experience the profound benefits of Yoga Nidra with us.

Wear comfortable clothes, and bring an open mind, a journal and eye mask if you have one (not required).

So, mark your calendar for the first Friday of each month and treat yourself to an evening of deep relaxation and mindfulness.

Let's come together and discover the transformative power of Yoga Nidra Meditation. See you there!

id: Ōtari Raranga Weavers 2025 Post Matariki Season - Beginners-Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush, 160 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Ōtari Raranga Weavers 2025 Post Matariki Season - Beginners
venue: Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush, 160 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington
description:
Kua raranga tahi tātou he whariki mō āpōpō
Together we weave the mat for future generations

Nau mai haere mai, all are welcome to attend Ōtari Raranga wānanga (classes).

No experience required and all materials provided. You will walk away with woven taonga at the end of every class.

Over 3-4 classes beginner students should complete a variety of putiputi (flowers), a kōnae (2 corner kete - basket), and a kono (4 sided kete). After completing 4 beginner classes (close together) you may have the skills to move up to our intermediate classes. Please talk with our kaiako and kaiāwhina if this is something you aspire to.

With regular attendance you will:
- Learn tikanga (protocols) and karakia for hauhake (harvesting) and preparing harakeke
- Build your mātauranga (knowledge)
- Use kupu Māori appropriate to raranga practice
- Develop your pūkenga (practical skills)
- Create taonga (treasures) for your whānau
- Build hononga (connections) within our raranga rōpū (group)
- Have the skills to practice at home.

What’s included in your beginners ticket?
- Three hour weaving class with experienced kaiako
- Access to tools and harakeke
- Harakeke is provided for your first two classes and then the tikanga is that you should hauhake (harvest) for yourself.
- If you are unable to harvest for class, we have a $20 ‘Please harvest for me’ option in addition to your ticket at least two days before class.
- Light refreshments are provided and we encourage you to bring kai to share

Led by Linda Lee (Ngāti Huia, Ngāti Raukawa, Ngāti Kurī, Te Rarawa, Te Aupōuri), and Anna Lees (Te Āti Awa, Kāi Tahu), and on occasion our raranga rangatira; Frank Topia (Ngā Puhi, Ngāti Porou, Ngāti Haua), with support from our kaiāwhina; Anita Murdoch (Ngati Kahungunu, Waikato-Tainui), Sarah O’Sullivan (Ngāi Tahu), Te Kāhui Tapsell (Te Arawa, Tainui), and Frankie Stewart (Tangata Tiriti).

Important information
- It is important that everyone turns up on time for karakia
- At our discretion tickets are fully refundable or transferable
- For tikanga purposes beginner ticket sales close two days before wānanga giving us time to hauhake (harvest) for you
- If class numbers are too low, we may have to cancel (and will offer a refund or transfer) so please check your emails before class
- We offer concession tickets for students, unwaged, seniors, and those with disabilities.
- It is important to us that our classes are accessible to all. If ticket costs are a barrier for you please visit our website to enquire about our reduced cost or free tickets
- We welcome children aged 10-14 but they should be accompanied by an adult with a ticket

Follow us on Facebook or Instagram: Otari Raranga Weavers
For more information about what to expect and what to bring visit our www.otariraranga.co.nz

We mihi to our funders and sponsors Wellington City Council, Wellington Gardens and the Ōtari-Wilton Bush Kaitiaki, Maverick Creative, Good Fortune Coffee and Wellington Apothecary.

id: Flautist Bridget Douglas with Elouan String Quartet-St Peters Village Hall, Cnr Beach Rd and Ames St, Paekākāriki-Event Finder
name: Flautist Bridget Douglas with Elouan String Quartet
venue: St Peters Village Hall, Cnr Beach Rd and Ames St, Paekākāriki
description:
Although some observers are predicting that classical music is losing popularity, the Mulled Wine Concerts organisation in Paekakariki is finding exactly the opposite. Its 2025 season has produced several sell-out events in Kapiti and the organiser, Mary Gow is in a upbeat mood about the next concert in the series. She notes "The Elouan Quartet who will be appearing at Paekakariki's iconic St Peter's Hall on Sunday July 20th features an outstanding chamber music quartet of principal players from the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra who will be accompanied by the very popular principal flautist, Bridget Douglas".



The Elouan Quartet with Bridget Douglas will present a captivating programme of music for flute and string quartet. Highlights include works by Mozart, Beethoven, Ginastera, Amy Beach, and Selina Fisher.These works are paired together in such a way as to compliment and contrast each other. Many of the works have a strong connection to the natural world, especially water, this most essential and beautiful compound that is our very lifeblood. The quartet comprises Jessica Oddie (violin), Anna Van der Zee (violin), Alexander McFarlane (viola} and Ken Ichinose (cello), names that will be familiar to followers of the NZSO. Bridget Douglas (flute) is also a well-known principal member of the orchestra



Almost every organisation involved in the arts in New Zealand is finding it tough going in 2025. Commercial sponsorship is very difficult to come by, and the grant-funding bodies are all facing cutbacks. But the demand is still there and Mulled Wine Concerts has found that their policy of presenting top-quality music in local venues and keeping ticket costs down as far as possible, is the right way to go. "We have had good audiences for our recent events" says Gow. "People who think twice about going into the capital and paying high prices for travel and tickets like the idea that they can have good music locally". With its popular combination of a string quartet and flute, presented by world-class musicians, Kapiti audiences will certainly appreciate the latest event in the series and it is likely to sell out quickly.



=======ENDS======



Mulled Wine Concerts present: The Elouan Quartet with Bridget Douglas

Sunday July 20, 2025 at 2:30PM at St Peter's Community Hall, Beach Road Paekakariki.



Tickets $35 (Student under 16, $15). Online Sales: marygow@gmail.com



Shop outlets: Magpie Paremata, 99 Mana Esplanade; Finn's Hotel, Paekakariki; Moby Dickens Bookshop, Paraparaumu Beach; Jenoa, 2 Mahara Place, Waikanae.



Info: www.mulledwineconcerts.com

id: Entrepreneurial Skills for Artists Workshop-Adam Concert Room, NZSM Kelburn Campus, Victoria University, Gate 7, Kelburn Parade, Wellington-Event Finder

description:
Spend your Saturday with fellow creatives at Leah Jane's "Entrepreneurial Skills for Artists" workshop! Let's chat about the skills and experience you need in your self-producing toolkit to bring sustainability, intention and agency to your creative practice.

In this workshop we will be discussing:


Fundraising and financing

Project planning and scheduling

Marketing and brand-building

Value mapping and community building

Pitching yourself and your work

And more!


Leah Jane will be bringing her experience as an independent artist, arts administrator and producer, as well as the knowledge she gained in her two-year Masters of Arts Management and Entrepreneurship (from the New School, New York City). Leah will be joined by special guests and a panel of industry leaders to discuss "pitching yourself and your work".

This workshop will be interactive and relaxed so bring yourself, your creative collaborators, and materials to write with. There will be opportunities to network and chat with other creatives, snacks and coffee, and a chance to ask all your burning questions.

Tickets are priced at:
$35 full price
$25 concession
$10 current students

All ticket proceeds will be going towards the costs of the event, koha for guests and Leah's fundraising efforts for her next New York adventure.

description:
Brace yourself for an exhilarating showcase of female adventurers pushing boundaries and defying expectations! The 2025 Gutsy Girls Adventure Film Tour brings you 2 and a half hours of heart-pounding action and soul-stirring stories from fearless women around the globe.

This year's lineup features six extraordinary short films capturing the raw intensity of: breathtaking mountaineering expeditions in the Alps, gravity-defying mountain biking with legend Robin Goomes, subterranean exploration with world-renowned cave diver Jill Heinerth and adrenaline-pumping snowboarding and BASE jumping in the Canadian Rockies.

Experience the thrill of adventure through a diverse collection of films varying in length and style, each spotlighting remarkable women who are redefining what's possible in the adventure world.

These aren't just films—they're powerful testaments to human potential. Watch as determination transforms into achievement, as fear gives way to courage, and as ordinary women accomplish extraordinary feats.

Whether you're an experienced adventurer or someone who dreams from the comfort of your couch, these stories will ignite your spirit and inspire your next challenge. The Gutsy Girls Adventure Film Tour offers an abundance of inspiration, regardless of age, gender, or experience level.

Join us for an unforgettable evening of inspiration, celebration, and pure adventure. Tickets are selling fast—secure yours now and prepare to be inspired!

Find out more at https://gutsygirlsadventurefilmtour.co.nz/

id: The Joy of Improvisation-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: The Joy of Improvisation
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Discover your creative potential and enjoy improvising scenes and stories in a safe, positive group environment with the Wellington Improvisation Troupe [WIT].

Description
Improv is theatre without a script and a fun way to build your skills in many areas, including team work, public speaking, storytelling and on-your-feet creative thinking.

This is the perfect place for absolute beginners to get acquainted with the joy and art of improvisation, inspired by the generous creative philosophy of Keith Johnstone. It's also a great place to get back into improv if you've been away from it for a while.

WIT has been teaching this course in association with the CEC for almost 20 years now. It uses fun games and structured exercises to teach the foundation skills of improv. These are a prerequisite for further courses and membership of WIT (www.wit.org.nz), as well as useful in themselves.

If you have questions about the course, please contact WIT directly on info@wit.org.nz.

By the end of the course, you'll have:

- Explored basic principles of improvisation
- Enjoyed interacting in a friendly, positive and supportive environment
- Developed more confidence, presentation and communication skills
- Experienced joyful moments of improvisation

The course will end with a directed demonstration of class exercises for invited friends and family.

[This is a physical activity that involves an element of risk. While all possible measures are taken to prevent accidents or injury, please note that participation is at your own risk].

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: Weaving Workshop with Robyn Parker-Hutt Art Society, 9-11 Myrtle St, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
name: Weaving Workshop with Robyn Parker
venue: Hutt Art Society, 9-11 Myrtle St, Lower Hutt
description:
Over six sessions you will learn the basics of handweaving.
The class will learn on shaft table looms that students will take home with them between classes. The looms are lent free of charge.
The names and function of each part of the loom will be described.
Students will learn how to choose the correct yarn for a particular project, wind a warp and put it on the loom (dress the loom). The warp is made up of individual threads wound around the loom itself.
Over the six lessons, students will first weave a project chosen by the tutor (a simple scarf) and then one or more projects of their own choice. Projects could include scarves, tea towels, small bags, table mats or runners etc. You will be guided in your choice of project, how to choose suitable yarns etc

id: Expressive Watercolour - 8 Week Course-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Expressive Watercolour - 8 Week Course
venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
description:
Watercolour is special because of the fluid properties that produce spontaneous and unique results. The inability to anticipate exactly what the paint will do makes watercolour an exciting medium to work with.

In this course we will learn to set the conditions for surprising and beautiful accidents to occur on the page. By incorporating these looser abstract elements into representational paintings we can convey heightened emotions in our work.

Throughout the term we will cover the following:

- The wet into wet technique to achieve one of a kind paint interactions.
- Learn about transparent colour mixing to create luminosity in your paintings.
- Use marbling to find organic shapes and patterns.
- Study the relationship between line and colour and the different ways they can be combined to find a personal style.
- Experiment with composition through collage.

Each class we will look at examples of historic and contemporary painting, and discuss how to selectively incorporate references into your work. Over the term you will build up a visual style and body of work.

Whether you’re new to watercolour or looking to expand your range, this course offers an opportunity to explore the expressive potential of watercolour.

Basic materials included.

Mornings:
Wednesdays, 10 am - 1 pm.
23 July - 10 September.

Evenings:
Mondays, 6-8 m
21 July - 8 September.

id: Leadlight Glass Suncatcher Day-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Leadlight Glass Suncatcher Day
venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
description:
Create gorgeous simple leadlight suncatchers with Lisa Sinclair.

A super fun day-class, ideal as a stand-alone experience, or as a day to get stuck into projects with your tutor at hand.

Beginners choose from a range of achievable patterns and choose their colour palette. They will learn to cut the glass, and prepare it before foiling and soldering each piece, creating a simple elegant colourful glass project.

The aim of this one day class is to leave with a completed small leadlight glass item.

More experienced students may bring existing projects to work on in class - though emphasis will be placed on focusing on the same techniques of flat, nicely soldered simple designs.

This is a warm and friendly class with excellent support and learning for complete beginners and more advanced students. All tools are supplied, though you are welcome to bring your own tools and glass if you have them.

Your materials for your beginner project are supplied as part of your course fee.
Additional materials and tools are available to purchase.

Not suitable for children. Older teenagers (16+) are welcome.

venue: Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Deva Mahal is stoked to present her new album Future Classic live to Aotearoa audiences for the first time. Born with the blues in her blood, Deva Mahal blends powerhouse vocals, soul-drenched songwriting, and genre-crossing artistry into a sound uniquely her own. Raised in Hawai’i and musically rooted in New Zealand, she emerged in New York with her debut album RUN DEEP (2018), and has since built an international career spanning sold-out tours, major festivals, and film appearances.

She has graced legendary stages from the Hollywood Bowl and Carnegie Hall to Bonnaroo and the Montreal Jazz Festival, appeared in David O. Russell’s American Hustle, and contributed to the soundtrack of The Experimenter. A three-time APRA Silver Scroll finalist and A2IM Indie Award nominee, and performed at the 2021 Biden-Harris Inauguration. She also featured and wrote on Ledisi’s Grammy-winning THE WILD CARD; contributed vocals to the new Kojey Radical album.

id: The Inner Magnet – Manifesting from the Inside Out-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: The Inner Magnet – Manifesting from the Inside Out
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars

The Inner Magnet – Manifesting from the Inside Out

Why do some desires seem to flow effortlessly into our lives, while others feel blocked at every turn? What if the key to manifestation isn’t about effort, but alignment?

This workshop explores how the wisdom of yoga philosophy can help us shift from the noise of a reactive, conditioned mind into a space of deeper inner alignment. Beyond just rewiring thoughts, yoga offers a map back to the part of us that is steady, clear, and deeply connected — an inner magnet that draws what is truly nourishing for our growth and transformation.

Through reflection, and an informed practice, you’ll be invited to consider how tuning inwards can begin to shape your outer reality in more meaningful ways. Whether you're new to yoga philosophy or have walked this path for a while, this session offers a grounded and enriching perspective on the subtle art of manifestation.

Meet your host, Rasesvari
Rasesvari is an events co-ordinator who loves to bring people together and create a warm and memorable experience. She thrives on connection with others and has a deep desire for a lifestyle of yoga, meditation and holistic healing.

id: Intro to 2D Traditional Animation - 8 Session Evening Course-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Intro to 2D Traditional Animation - 8 Session Evening Course
venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
description:
This is a beginners course in 2D animation where you'll learn the time-honoured principles of hand-drawn animation and how to apply them to your own animation project. You may work on a project incorporating your own ideas, or if you'd rather, an assigned a project from your tutor.

You can use any device, ipad or laptop you already own (except a mobile – it's really not big enough to do good animation on). The school does not provide any digital equipment.

Your tutor, Ross Payne, is a 30 year veteran of traditional 2D animation, and loves to share his knowledge about it for you to love it as much as he does.

In each lesson there will be examples and demonstrations of the animation principles with follow up exercises to put your new skills into practice. You'll work on your project both during class and at home, applying the animation principles to your individualised project.

You can choose to draw your animation on paper then scan/capture into your device, or choose to draw your animation digitally, directly into an animation programme. which ever you choose, instructions in class will be provided to give you the skills needed for this step.

Ross will advice you on the a variety of animation apps/programmes available online to use, ranging in price from free to not very much.

Note - A computer mouse can be used for 2D animation but digital pens are much easier to use. Prior to the course commencing, you'll receive details of recommended programmes to use for the course.

Tuesday evenings, 6:30 - 8:30 pm.
22 July - 9 September.

Join Wellington Candle Co. for a truly unique and premium experience designed for friends, dates, or anyone looking to cozy up this winter with a touch of handcrafted luxury.

What to Expect at this Premium Experience:

Craft Your Signature Scent:
Dive into the meditative art of candle making! You'll learn the secrets behind selecting and blending premium fragrance oils to create a soothing aroma that's uniquely yours.

Your Handcrafted Masterpiece:
Guided by Wellington Candle Co., you'll pour your very own 250g wood-wick candle using high-quality soy wax, all housed in a beautiful, large white glass jar with an elegant wooden lid.

The Botanist's Delights:
While your wax cools and sets (the perfect time for a break!), indulge in a delightful array of gourmet platters and small plates expertly prepared by The Botanist.

Bubbles or Brews:
Your ticket includes one complimentary glass of bubbles or a refreshing non-alcoholic drink to enjoy as you create and mingle. Additional coffees or drinks can be purchased directly from The Botanist's cafe.

A Take-Home Treasure:
At the end of our relaxing 2-hour session, you'll proudly take home your finished, personalized candle, ready to infuse your space with warmth and your chosen winter-inspired scent.

*Photography & Videography Consent: Wellington Candle Co. reserves the right to use photos and videos taken during the event for publicity materials and social media. By booking, you grant permission for your likeness to be used in our marketing materials without further consent or compensation.

You hereby waive, release, and discharge any and all rights and claims against Wellington Candle Co. and its staff for any personal injury, property damage, or other claims arising from your participation in the workshop or incidents on the premises (including, but not limited to, slips and falls, or burns). Every effort will be made by Wellington Candle Co. to ensure your safety.

id: NZSO Firebird: Ravel & Stravinsky-Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Wakefield Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: NZSO Firebird: Ravel & Stravinsky
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Wakefield Street, Wellington
description:
J Ritchie Papanui Road Concert Overture
de Falla Nights in the Gardens of Spain
Ravel Piano Concerto in G Major
Stravinsky Suite from The Firebird (1945 version)

Spanish pianist Javier Perianes, able to “make the piano sing and glitter with alert, polished brilliance” (Sydney Morning Herald), joins us for two virtuoso masterworks. Ravel’s Piano Concerto in G explores both Ravel’s Spanish Basque roots and the enlivening rhythms of jazz, while de Falla’s portrait of Andalusian Spain is darker, dramatic, and seductive. Meanwhile, Stravinsky’s Firebird conjures images of the magical glowing bird of Russian myth, but John Ritchie brings us back to earth with the clanging tramcar bell and 1950s hustle of Christchurch’s Papanui Road.

Leading our tour of these pictorial works is Winner of the Finnish critics’ prize 2021 for the Best Newcomer in the Arts, Emilia Hoving. “Hoving is a conductor on the rise, and for good reason. She has a highly precise, refined and inventive conducting technique that combines airy breathability with power” (Turku Sanomat).

id: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Callum Passells-Bedlam and Squalor, Upstairs, 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Callum Passells
venue: Bedlam and Squalor, Upstairs, 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
The seventh concert in our series is a new suite of music by Tāmaki Makaurau composer, performer, and educator; Callum Passells.

For the Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Callum brings new music for his ensemble LCR, an ensemble which features three identical saxophone trios (sax, bass, and drums) that play with and against each other in a kaleidoscopic and often explosive fashion. The new pieces commissioned for this series continue to stretch at the fabric of jazz and improvised forms, and are inspired by Morton Feldman, Lennie Tristano, Henry Threadgill and Sly Stone.

Callum has been deeply involved in the New Zealand jazz and improvised music scene for over a decade, and is a busy freelancer in the wider music community in Auckland. He has performed with Aldous Harding, Hans Pucket, the Exploding Rainbow Orchestra, the Auckland Philharmonia Orchestra, among many others. In 2021, Callum was commissioned to compose a large-scale work 'Solid Spirit, Liquid Body' for the Wellington Jazz Festival. He is currently completing a Master of Music degree at the University of Auckland, where he also teaches saxophone.

The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15, door sales $20.

description: Learn how to make the transition from buddy to boss and lead a successful team. As John F. Kennedy once said, “leadership and learning are indispensable to each other”. Our Leadership & Management courses are designed to help you get the best performance from yourself and your team, providing you with the skills and techniques to become better than you ever perceived you could be. The Leadership & Management Part 2 workshop will equip leaders and managers with the skills to build high performing and highly motivated teams; the skills to communicate effectively as a leader, become more self-aware, provide coaching and mentoring, deal with conflict in a constructive and productive manner along with developing ways to solve problems as a team. This workshop also gives participants an understanding of the key concepts of leadership and leadership styles along with how to choose and implement a leadership style that is authentic and beneficial to both the organisation and the teams they serve. You will make a medium sized candle and a set of tea light candles. A range of floral signature scents are provided for you to choose from for your candle. Each scent has a connection to a specific symbolism, from the Language of Flowers.

A selection of dried floral products are provided to decorate your candles and packaging, to enable safe transportation home.

This workshop is suitable for children 8+ years with an adult in attendance.

id: Bookmark Kāpiti: Book & Story Festival-Kapiti, District Wide, Paraparaumu-Event Finder

venue: Kapiti, District Wide, Paraparaumu
description:
Come join us for our first ever book festival!

Bookmark Kāpiti celebrates the people, stories and places of Kāpiti.

Over 25 events covering the whole district – we are showcasing the rich creative diversity of Kāpiti through stories and writing for all kinds of readers, writers and storytellers.

We have workshops, talks and performances for children, young people and adults – from sunny Ōtaki to wild Paekākāriki.

Our interactive CycleStory will populate the ‘Coast 35’ route. Grab your bike or walk a part of the trail to connect people, story and place.

Full programme information on our website or grab your tickets via the link today!

id: Hilarious Hypnosis Show-Lower Hutt Event Centre , 30C Laings Road , Lower Hutt-Event Finder
name: Hilarious Hypnosis Show
venue: Lower Hutt Event Centre , 30C Laings Road , Lower Hutt
description:
As seen on Seven Sharp & going viral on TikTok, you're in for a treat with Comedy Hypnotist, Haiming Jiang, bringing his Comedy Hypnosis show to the New Zealand Comedy Festival. Be prepared to laugh hysterically & to take part too, if you're up for it! It's a night of fun!

Haiming combines hypnosis with comedy to entertain the audience while demonstrating the benefits of hypnosis through audience participation. With his unique cultural background and understanding of New Zealand, this is a must-see event for any fun-loving Kiwi interested in hypnosis, offering an enjoyable and exciting experience. Come and find out how this Chinese hypnotist uses hypnosis to both entertain audiences and relax participants.

Experience the hilarious Comedy Hypnosis Show where you become the star of the show! If you want/consent - this is a no-pressure scenario!

id: Park Run Jingle Paws Jog-Woodside Station, Woodside Rd, Greytown-Event Finder
name: Park Run Jingle Paws Jog
venue: Woodside Station, Woodside Rd, Greytown
description:
Work off some of those Festival doughnuts, tacos and burgers with a 5km run or stroll along the picturesque Greytown Rail Trail, stretching from Woodside Railway Station to Cotter Street. Whether you prefer running, walking, or even dancing your way through, everyone is welcome to participate!

This Christmas-themed fun run is all about festive cheer, where four-legged friends are also very welcome! Dress yourself - and your pup - in their holiday best. Think reindeer antlers, tinsel collars, or elf outfits—and join fellow runners and dog lovers for a joyful morning on the trail.

It’s the paw-fect way to start the weekend with your furry companion. Expect plenty of photo ops, treats, and tail wags along the way!
Event Details:
• Time: Starts at 8.00am
• Location: Greytown Rail Trail, starting from Woodside Railway Station entrance
• Activities: 5km run/walk/dance along the trail
• Special Note: Dogs must be on a lead
• Cost: FREE
• Prizes? You bet. Spot prizes for best dressed person, and best dressed dog.

id: Mindfulness Meditation-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Mindfulness Meditation
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Being mindful can help make us more resilient to life’s challenges and give us more tools for dealing with strong emotions and stress or just enlivening the daily grind.

If you’d like a hand with learning to relax or would like to get fresh insights into why we behave as we do, this course will help. It’s totally secular, practical and takes us all just as we are.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
- Describe some elements of Buddhism through a secular lens
- Describe practical tips to make your meditation time successful
- Practise guided and silent meditation and the importance of ‘noticing how things are’
- Find resources to support you in a long-term, and even life-long, approach to mindfulness
- Describe three elements of the mindfulness revolution in psychology and mental health

Each session includes practical meditation exercises and opportunities for discussion. Bring a notepad and pen.


Duration 4 weeks

Presented by Jan Rivers.

id: Martinborough Mid-Winter Christmas Event (Lunch / Dinner)-Tirohana Estate Vineyard, 42 Puruatanga Rd, Martinborough-Event Finder
name: Martinborough Mid-Winter Christmas Event (Lunch / Dinner)
venue: Tirohana Estate Vineyard, 42 Puruatanga Rd, Martinborough
description:
As the year reaches the half-way point, what better way to keep warm this winter and celebrate with friends and family than by booking a table at Tirohana's Mid-Winter Christmas themed nights (and days) to be held over lunch and dinner over two weekends (June 27-29 and July 25-27).

An annual tradition in Martinborough and the Wairarapa, Tirohana Cellars' Restaurant will be transformed into a magical Christmas winter wonderland, with twinkling fairy lights, mulled wine, Christmas trees, evocative music, the warmth of the open fire - and who knows, we might even get some snow in the vineyard!? :)

There is a festive menu where Christmas turkey and all the trimmings will be on offer (with options for vegetarians/special diets). But there are plenty of other options on the menu available for those who do not want to indulge in Turkey and ham off the bone, plum pudding and other favourites.

Lunch is three courses (starter, main, dessert) for $65 pp and Dinner is $75 pp for five courses (amuse bouche, starter, main, dessert, petit fours)

A wonderful lunch or dinner for a couple or a group, this Tirohana institution is something you won't want to miss. If you're feeling particularly festive, why not dress to suit the occasion - we'll be running a competition on our Facebook page for the best Midwinter photo.

Reservations are essential to secure a table for lunch or dinner.

To book a table please call 06 306 9933 or email makeabooking@tirohanaestate.com or book online https://www.tirohanaestate.com/restaurant/book-a-table/.

id: Ōtari Raranga Weavers 2025 Post Matariki Season - Intermediate-Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush, 160 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Ōtari Raranga Weavers 2025 Post Matariki Season - Intermediate
venue: Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush, 160 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington
description:
Ma te mōhio ka roa, ma te ora ka mōhio
Through learning there is life, through life there is learning

Nau mai haere mai, all are welcome to attend Ōtari Raranga Wānanga.

After completing 4 beginner classes (close together) as well as practice at home you may be ready to move up to our intermediate classes. We will work with you to plan the projects you wish to complete and support you to do so. Potential projects can include new closes for your kete timata, kete waikawa, puritanga, pīkau and pōtae. This involves preparation, preservation and storage of harakeke - important especially over winter months.

With regular attendance you will deepen mātauranga gained from beginner classes and share you learnings with others. (Refer to below for a reminder).

What’s included in your intermediate ticket?
- Three hour weaving class with our tuakana weavers and raranga rangatira.
- Limited access to tools as you are expected to be building up your own kete mahi (tool kit).
- You are expected to bring your own harakeke.
- If you are unable to harvest for class, we have ‘Please harvest for me’ options in addition to your ticket at least two days before class.
- Light refreshments are provided and we encourage you to bring kai to share

Led by our raranga Rangatira; Frank Topia (Ngā Puhi, Ngāti Porou, Ngāti Haua) with Linda Lee (Ngāti Huia, Ngāti Raukawa, Ngāti Kurī, Te Rarawa, Te Aupōuri), and Anna Lees (Te Āti Awa, Kāi Tahu). Supported by our kaiāwhina; Anita Murdoch (Ngati Kahungunu and Waikato-Tainui), Sarah O’Sullivan (Ngāi Tahu), Te Kāhui Tapsell (Te Arawa, Tainui), and Frankie Stewart (Tangata Tiriti).

Important information
- It is important that everyone turns up on time for karakia.
- At our discretion tickets are fully refundable or transferable.
- If class numbers are too low, we may have to cancel (and will offer a refund or transfer) so please check your emails before class.
- We offer concession tickets for students, unwaged, seniors, and those with disabilities.
- It is important to us that our classes are accessible to all. If ticket costs are a barrier for you please visit our website to enquire about our reduced cost or free tickets.

Follow us on Facebook or Instagram: Otari Raranga Weavers

For more information about what to expect and what to bring visit our www.otariraranga.co.nz
TICKETING INFORMATION
Tuakana = Older sibling
Intermediate / Tuakana - General Admission: $25
Intermediate / Tuakana - Concession Admission: $20
Intermediate / Tuakana - Koha Admission: $10
Two Class Pass - Two back to back dates only: $45.00

ADD ON - Harvest for me: $20 + eventfinder fees (10 rau only) - 3 days notice required
ADD ON - Harvest for me: $40 + eventfinder fees (20 rau only) - 3 days notice required

Note: Eventfinda fees apply

We mihi to our funders and sponsors Wellington City Council, Wellington Gardens and the Ōtari-Wilton Bush Kaitiaki, Maverick Creative, Good Fortune Coffee and Wellington Apothecary.

With regular attendance you will:
- Learn tikanga (protocols) and karakia for hauhake (harvesting) and preparing harakeke
- Build your mātauranga (knowledge)
- Use kupu Māori appropriate to raranga practice
- Develop your pūkenga (practical skills)
- Create taonga (treasures) for your whānau
- Build hononga (connections) within our raranga rōpū (group)

Donations, Tax Credits and Corporate Gifting
- We accept koha to support Ōtari Raranga Weavers via Shared Lines Trust. This enables us to continue to offer subsidised and free events to the community.
- Shared Lines Trust is registered with Charities Service; Shared Lines Trust (CC61762)
- All donations over $5 made to The Trust are tax-deductible
- For corporate gifting or individuals requesting tax credits please email SharedLinesTrust@gmail.com
- Visit www.sharedlines.org.nz for more information

id: Troy Roberts Quartet-Bedlam and Squalor, Upstairs, 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Troy Roberts Quartet
venue: Bedlam and Squalor, Upstairs, 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
WJC is excited to announce a special one-off concert featuring Grammy nominated saxophonist, Troy Roberts.

Embracing his love for a vast variety of stylistic genres, three-time GRAMMY nominated saxophonist, Troy Roberts is quickly becoming one of the most widely recorded touring artists of his time. As a go-to first call saxophonist, his name adorns several essential recordings ranging from the legendary Joey DeFrancesco, the iconic Van Morrison, the quintessential Jeff "Tain" Watts, the tireless Orrin Evans’ Captain Black Big Band, the critically acclaimed Kurt Elling, the breathtaking Veronica Swift, including numerous other jazz veterans, and newcomers considered tastemakers of their generation.

The New York City based Australian immigrant is also a prolific leader with sixteen releases to his name. Currently celebrating his latest, Green Lights (featuring John Patitucci, Paul Bollenback and Jimmy Macbride), Roberts maintains a busy recording and performance schedule with his quartet, his original project Nu-Jive, as well as some of the greatest artists of today. With a busy international schedule, it is not often that Roberts finds time to schedule NZ dates, so this show is not to be missed!

Joining Troy Roberts (tenor saxophone), Duncan Haynes (piano), Seth Boy (acoustic bass), Mark Lockett (drums).

Troy Roberts continues to be a master of styles and configurations with this eminently accessible, sonically and rhythmically engaging session, emitting steam and sumptuous harmonic colors along the way. -Glide Magazine

Tickets are also available on Eventfinda and at the door for a masterclass by Troy Roberts at Bedlam & Squalor on 2 August at 4pm.

Example: are you planning to travel to India? Or just interested in learning a new language?
We teach basic writing, reading and speaking in 6 sessions, and also teach more advanced levels if anyone wants to learn more. Classes are available everyday. Day and time can be arranged according to our availability.

id: Painting In Oils - Eight Week Course-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Painting In Oils - Eight Week Course
venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
description:
This class is open to all levels of students interested in exploring the possibilities of this traditional medium. The main exercises will be based on a still life, however students are free to explore subjects of their choice.

This course focuses on the technique of oil painting. You will learn to:

- Choose a colour palette
- Choose and prepare supports on which to paint on with oils
- Create a composition according to the subject selected
- Learn how to render volume and form
- Learn expressive qualities of colour and brushwork
- Students will also learn to stretch their own canvas

If you want to explore the possibilities of painting in oils then this is the course for you.

Tuesday mornings, 10 am - 1 pm. 22 July - 9 September.

id: Wellington Winter Foraging for Wild Edible Weeds: SOLD OUT-Innermost Gardens Site, Lawson Place, Mt Victoria, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Wellington Winter Foraging for Wild Edible Weeds: SOLD OUT
venue: Innermost Gardens Site, Lawson Place, Mt Victoria, Wellington
description:
Join Felicity of Homegrown Botanica for a wander around the edges of the Innermost Community gardens to learn about commonly found, wild, edible weeds. Build a relationship with a natural world that is overflowing with abundant, wild, edible, nutritious, medicinal plants. Learn their names & get to know them, along with folklore & stories from the past.

By the end of the workshop you will:
- understand the basic principles of foraging, including sustainable harvesting
- feel confident in identifying 10-15 wild edible plants
- know about their nutritional & medicinal benefits
- know about common toxic/dangerous plants to avoid when foraging
- know about the best ways to prepare your foraged greens for maximum nutritional benefit & flavor
- feel empowered to include foraged greens in your everyday diet

Walk away with hands on, practical skills & knowledge that you can use in your own life.

Investment includes hands on wild weed walk & discussion, cup of foraged herbal tea & wildly delicious foraged snack.

To learn more about Felicity and her offerings,
visit @homegrownbotanica on social media
or www.homegrownbotanica.co.nz.
For any queries, please email felicity@homegrownbotanica.co.nz.

id: Cooking - Vietnamese Street Food-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Cooking - Vietnamese Street Food
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Gain a panoramic picture of popular Vietnamese Street Foods, which you can enjoy at any time of day and find out how to make some of them with ingredients you can easily find in New Zealand.

All ingredients provided.

Join our experienced Vietnamese cook and find out how to create a range of traditional dishes from different parts of Vietnam that you can eat for breakfast, lunch and dinner or at any time of day. Recipes include delicious wraps, pancakes, beef noodle soup, fried rolls with rice noodles and much more.

By the end of the course, you will be able to: - Define what characterises Vietnamese cooking and key ingredients -

Recognise and make popular street food from North to South of Vietnam - Identify retail outlets which supply Vietnamese ingredients - More confidently follow recipes provided and prepare those recipes with supervision - Prepare dishes for home eating or entertaining

All ingredients provided but bring an apron, dish cloth, tea towels and containers to take food home.

Note:

Our cooking courses are designed to provide a collaborative and immersive learning experience where learners often work in pairs and/or groups. While we wish to create an inclusive environment for all participants, it is important to note that our courses are unable to accommodate specific food allergies or deviate from the preplanned dishes and menus.

Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: Sea Glass Rings - One Day Jewellery Making Workshop-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Sea Glass Rings - One Day Jewellery Making Workshop
venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
description:
Design and create a unique ring with foraged sea glass ‘gems’ while learning and developing core jewellery fabrication techniques. An opportunity to engage in creative recycling by turning seaside flotsam into precious wearable treasures. Experiment with ring textures and forms in silver, brass and/or copper, then set your unique glass ‘gemstone’. Finish up with your choice of polish, including high lustre gloss, steel brushed satin, or darkened antique finishes.

If you can, please beachcomb and bring along some sea glass options - ideally around 1cm wide, and with a flat back.


Techniques:

- Create a ring with one bezel set foraged sea glass ‘gem’
- Use jeweller’s callipers to measure and prepare metal
- Use jeweller’s saws or snips to cut and shape metal
- Use files and sanding to refine and smooth metal edges and surfaces
- Use jeweller’s flame torches to solder join metal pieces
- Use Dremel & bench polishers to refine & finish metal casts into wearable jewellery

Project : 1 Ring with sea glass (silver, brass and copper options)
Materials: Sea Glass, Copper, Brass, Sterling Silver

One hour lunch - bring a packed lunch to have in our historic home or explore the local cafes in Te Aro.

Daylong workshop options on either Sunday 20 July or Sunday 24 August.

id: Paint and Wine Night - Orchids-The Arborist Rooftop Bar, 166 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder

description:
The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

name: Oyster Saloon with Martin Bosley

name: Salmonella Dub Soundsystem

description:
Salmonella Dub originator Andrew Penman (aka Dj Rudeboy) drives the Sal Dub SoundSystem Machine featuring the Mighty Asterix & Whirimako Black on vocals with the epic Sal Dub horn section live. Prepare for an audio visual dance floor journey through the basslands of Salmonella Dub back catalogue + new tunes from the For All Things Alive and versions featured on next release.

id: Revelation Valley-BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Revelation Valley
venue: BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington
description:
Experience the artistry of theatre-maker Lisa Maule and special guests in this poetry premiere.

---
Three years ago surrounded by books and thinking about constitutional change, Pākehā theatre maker Lisa Maule decided to write poetry. "Revelation Valley" is a selection of her writing performed by Lisa with titles such as My Capitalist Stapler, Cohesion is Also a Radical Act and Is it Hate? (a poem about love).

Each night a different invited guest adds to the creativity with a taste of their own work. Guests are Dylan Fa'atui, Eru Moriarty, Aische Arawelo, Jim Moriarty, and Heather Came. The show also features music collaboration with Michelle Scullion.

Embrace unexpected laughs, challenge your norms and immerse yourself in creativity.

"Not a straight town at all, not a straight down. An asphalt zigzag.
Home to hydrangea’s, cats, rats, cars, tartan trinkets, china tea cups
and
traces
of
ancient trees."
(Lisa Maule)

---
Lisa Maule grew up in Wellington where she was born and went to Karori Normal School and Wellington Girls College. Her heritage is English and Scottish. She has two young adult children and two black fluffy dogs. As a theatre maker Lisa started in the 1990s, her first role outside of university was as the technical operator at BATS Theatre on a Red Mole show. Other formative experiences were at Taki Rua Theatre and with women's theatre such as Not Broadcast Quality and Magdalena Aotearoa. She is Producer / Kaihautū at the Maori theatre company Te Rākau Hua o Te Wao Tapu working alongside Jim Moriarty and Helen Pearse-Otene

The creative practice Lisa is best known for is her lighting design work and she also loves to draw, paint and make collage. Lisa has a penchant for collecting chairs and she is good at cutting cardboard.

id: Writing A Novel-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Writing A Novel
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Kick start your novel in this series of weekly workshops with practical writing exercises which will build ideas, form the raw material of your book and get you started.

Description
An introductory course for those keen to start writing a novel.

By the end of the course, you'll be able to:
- Generate ideas for writing your novel
- Create convincing characters
- Write compelling dialogue
- Develop a strong structure for your story
- Follow the process towards completing your first draft

Bring pen and paper.

This course is designed to help you improve your skills, to develop your unique writer's voice and to encourage you to take risks on the page. It is not a course where you'll be asked to read your work out loud, critique other writers' work, or hand in your writing to the tutor. This is a safe place where you will be supported to do what writers do best - write.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

Duration 8 weeks,
Donna Banicevich-Gera

id: Creative Writing - A Tasting Plate-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Creative Writing - A Tasting Plate
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Get your creativity flowing by exploring some of the star forms of creative writing, focusing each week on a different area of fiction or creative non-fiction.

How often have you said, ‘I wish I could write’? There are many different kinds of writing. Starting is easy so why not give it a go by joining this creative writing ‘tasting plate’.

Each week we’ll focus on a different area of fiction or creative non-fiction. By the end of the programme, you’ll have tried your hand at writing a short story, a narrative poem, a travel memoir, a personal essay drawing from your life, an interview article, a story for children, a short film script and a piece of historical fiction.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
- Create works of fiction
- Develop creative non-fiction text
- Explore the natural inner spirit of writing
- Discover your unique writer’s voice
- Reflect on your own experiences in writing
- Investigate different writing strategies
- Discover where your personal writing passions sit and what works for you.

Bring pen and paper or a laptop.

This course is designed to help you improve your skills, to develop your unique writer's voice and to encourage you to take risks on the page. It is not a course where you'll be asked to read your work out loud, critique other writers work, or hand in your writing to the tutor. This is a safe place where you will be supported to do what writers do best - write.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: Daily Keyno And Warm Regards-Valhalla, 154 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Daily Keyno And Warm Regards
venue: Valhalla, 154 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
Daily Keyno & Warm Regards

Daily Keyno, the brain child of Mark Sommerville, is proud to announce the release of their debut album, That’s my jc, available on all major streaming platforms starting September 25th..

That’s my jc is a personal project, featuring 8 tracks that explore themes of love, loneliness, fatherhood, past reflections. The album showcases Daily Keyno’s signature spacious, crystal like guitar, while pushing into new sonic territory.

Lead singles like Sunlight. Sugar and Peaches & Creme have already garnered critical acclaim, with Sunlight. Sugar was praised by Glen Thurston of Music, Movies & Madness as A lot of fun, a dreamy musical experience. The album also features the slick rhythm section of Riki Gooch, Jacqui Nyman, and Dayle Jellyman

This album is a reflection of where I am creatively and emotionally right now, says Sommerville. I wanted to make something sincere and sonically simple/minimal.

Leading up to the release, Daily Keyno will be performing -
July 16th - Valhalla, Te Whanganui a tara

Tracklist for That’s my jc:
1. Ocean Blue
2. My beautifully sad walk home
3. Birth
4. Days drag
5. My love is shining
6. Sunlight. Sugar
7. Dayle on the record
8. Peaches & Creme

Warm Regards are a Te Whanganui-a-Tara based country dream-rock band.
They are great mates, and have over 150 years of experience playing in bands and being human beings.
They are super pumped to be playing with their friends Daily Keyno at Valhalla - it’s going to be a great night!!
They recently released this song. Listen to it!!

id: The Oscar Garvie Quartet Plays Coltrane-The Rogue and Vagabond, 18 Garrett St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: The Oscar Garvie Quartet Plays Coltrane
venue: The Rogue and Vagabond, 18 Garrett St, Wellington
description:
Join us for a powerful evening of music celebrating the legacy of one of jazz’s most visionary artists — John Coltrane. From his soulful early ballads and hard bop classics to the boundary-pushing spiritual intensity of his later free jazz works, this performance traces the full arc of Coltrane’s musical journey.



Led by drummer Oscar Garvie, the group is anchored by the expressive and deeply studied playing of saxophonist Isaac Randel, whose sound channels the fire and depth of Coltrane’s voice. Randel brings a commanding front-line presence and a profound connection to the material, making him the perfect interpreter of Coltrane’s vast and evolving musical language.



The band also features Jack Harris on bass and Tane Kelly on piano — a dynamic rhythm section that navigates the full emotional and sonic range of Coltrane’s music.



Together, this quartet dives into every era of Coltrane’s work — from the lyrical beauty of Naima and the modal mastery of Impressions, to the raw, transcendent fire of Ascension and Interstellar Space. This tribute isn’t just a look back — it’s a living, breathing expression of what Coltrane’s music still means

Music from 9pm, FREE ENTRY
