id: Jewellery Making - Precious Stones in Cast Rings-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Jewellery Making - Precious Stones in Cast Rings
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Create sculptural rings studded with dazzling precious gemstones! Combine wax working and stone setting methods to produce a set of rings cast in your choice of copper, brass, bronze, white bronze and silver - beginners welcome!
All materials included in the course fee.

Description

Expanding on the Lost Wax Cast Rings class, students in this course get to add precious gemstones to their cast jewellery process!
Experiment and create sculptural cast metal rings set with beautiful stones in a variety of colours.
This beginner friendly jewellery class is also fun and engaging for returning students to diversify their skills and set stones in new ways.
Students will learn to work with a range of jeweller waxes, including hard wax, modelling wax, sheet wax, melting wax and more to create wax 'masters', setting stones in wax, as well as turning raw metal casts into shining ready-to-wear jewellery.
Students choose their favourite wax masters to be cast professionally outside of class time, transforming the designs into their choice of metals, and are returned to students to polish and finish their casts in class.

The course fee includes a range of small precious gemstones, casting 2 rings in either copper, brass, yellow bronze, white bronze, and 2 rings cast in Sterling Silver.

The bold, organic forms and textures of the lost wax processes offer a wide range of creative possibilities beyond the scope of fabrication methods alone (soldering metal sheet and wire). Setting faceted stones in wax offers a simpler and more experimental way of adding stones to jewellery compared to fabrication settings.

All materials are included in the course fee. Please bring pen and paper and your reading glasses (if you use these) and wear clothing and footwear suitable for a workshop environment.

By the end of the course, students will be able to:

Design and create unique sculptural ring designs

Carve hard jeweller’s wax ring master designs to fit a chosen finger size for casting

Sculpt soft jeweller’s wax master design to fit a chosen finger size for casting

Combine hard and soft jeweller’s wax to create unique designs ready for casting

Set faceted gemstones in wax for ‘cast-in-place’ setting methods

File, sand and polish metal casts into finished jewellery

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington
description:
Eat Your Art Out brings a creative twist to high tea, inspired by the bold and brilliant works of Toi Art.

Enjoy a menu of classic treats with an artistic edge: from the Sweet William’s Dish, Golden Ratio Scone, Madeleine Moment, and the Mint to Be mousse. Each dish is a playful nod to the world of art, clever, colourful, and made to be shared.

Set Menu
(Includes one of each item per person)

Cheery Cherry Curator
A silky milk chocolate crémeux layered with vibrant cherry glaze and topped with a dark chocolate disc creates a perfectly balanced blend of tart and sweet

Mint to Be
Cool mint and sweet strawberry mousse gently resting on a white chocolate base, combining vibrant flavours that are meant to be together

Madeleine Moment
A citrus-infused madeleine paired with silky sambuca namelaka, vibrant green apple gel, and an elegant chocolate garnish delivers golden flavours with a playful twist

Sweet William’s Dish
Mānuka honey ganache nestled in a crisp vanilla tart shell, topped with a chocolate ‘The Dish’ by William De Morgan. A refined take on New Zealand’s liquid gold

The Golden Ratio
A perfectly proportioned cheese scone layered with sundried tomatoes, olives, and fresh basil brings Mediterranean flavours in perfect balance

The Pecking Order
Tender horopito-spiced chicken layered with creamy Tatua mayo and peppery watercress on fresh focaccia fingers, with native pepper leaf adding a bold, warming kick

Still Life with Eggplant
Tangy eggplant and native kawakawa caponata with buffalo bocconcini and fragrant basil pesto on artisanal brioche. A bold sandwich blending native botanicals and classic flavours.

id: Chasing the Light-South Coast Studio, 1/408 The Esplanade, Island Bay, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Chasing the Light
venue: South Coast Studio, 1/408 The Esplanade, Island Bay, Wellington
description:
Creating a sense of light is a voyage of discovery. Good lighting makes a composition believable and emotionally resonant. We learn through practical exercises with examples from classical and contemporary artists and references from nature.

This is an introductory workshop and a pathway for an ongoing journey.

What we will cover


Greater awareness of light in form and composition

Tone is more important than colour

Different types of light

Colour temperature 

Local colour shifts under different lighting


Observe real life whenever possible.
Use soft transitions for form shadows.
Keeping light consistent across the scene.
Light revealing form; shadows hiding it.

What you will come away with:


Tone and value ranges

Studies in monochrome, which can be the basis of a coloured work

Downloadable handouts


Why Come?


A painting with good lighting always attracts the viewer. 

Understanding and constantly learning about light is integral to painting.

Developing an understanding of light rewards and expands your art practice


Notes
There is a minimum of four participants for this class to go ahead. 

Marc’s background
Marc has a background in film and theatre, art directing Maxwell Tapes and Turkish Delight directed by Howard Guard.

Around 2010 he took up photography and filming,  He’s worked with pilots throughout New Zealand, Alaska and the Canadian Arctic providing experiences resetting how he experienced light and mood.

These days he paints full-time and is represented by Exhibitions Gallery Wellington

id: Gutsy Girls Adventure Film Tour NZ 2025-Embassy Theatre, 10 Kent Terrace, Mt Victoria, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Gutsy Girls Adventure Film Tour NZ 2025
venue: Embassy Theatre, 10 Kent Terrace, Mt Victoria, Wellington
description:
Brace yourself for an exhilarating showcase of female adventurers pushing boundaries and defying expectations! The 2025 Gutsy Girls Adventure Film Tour brings you 2 and a half hours of heart-pounding action and soul-stirring stories from fearless women around the globe.

This year's lineup features six extraordinary short films capturing the raw intensity of: breathtaking mountaineering expeditions in the Alps, gravity-defying mountain biking with legend Robin Goomes, subterranean exploration with world-renowned cave diver Jill Heinerth and adrenaline-pumping snowboarding and BASE jumping in the Canadian Rockies.

Experience the thrill of adventure through a diverse collection of films varying in length and style, each spotlighting remarkable women who are redefining what's possible in the adventure world.

These aren't just films—they're powerful testaments to human potential. Watch as determination transforms into achievement, as fear gives way to courage, and as ordinary women accomplish extraordinary feats.

Whether you're an experienced adventurer or someone who dreams from the comfort of your couch, these stories will ignite your spirit and inspire your next challenge. The Gutsy Girls Adventure Film Tour offers an abundance of inspiration, regardless of age, gender, or experience level.

Join us for an unforgettable evening of inspiration, celebration, and pure adventure. Tickets are selling fast—secure yours now and prepare to be inspired!

Find out more at https://gutsygirlsadventurefilmtour.co.nz/
ONE SCREENING ONLY

The Gutsy Girls Adventure Film Tour is exempt from classification, but the films are suitable for all ages (none of the films include swearing or drug references).
Seating is not allocated. Arrive early for the best seats. Sorry NO REFUNDS.

id: The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos
Transform the exhausting cycle of mental loops, rumination, and decision paralysis into mental clarity and peace.

This 60-minute workshop will give you practical tools to break the cycle. You'll discover why your brain fixates on worry, how to interrupt rumination before it spirals, and master simple techniques that create instant mental clarity. Walk away with a proven system based on FasterEFT for transforming your overthinking patterns into inner peace, so you can finally quiet the noise and reclaim control of your mind.

Plus, your ticket includes a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert—because taking care of your mind is best supported by feeding your body well.

Meet Krishnaloka, your host

Introducing Krishnaloka, who is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology. As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.

id: Beginner's Weekend-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Beginner's Weekend
venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
description:
A fabulous and fun introduction to jewellery making over two mornings, this is our most popular short workshop! Give yourself a gift of a new hobby and walk out of the class with a unique beautiful piece of jewellery!

The students start with basic ring making in copper or brass. We begin with ring making as this process teaches students many fundamental techniques in one project, measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting, soldering and finishing are all included in this one ring.

Students will learn how to measure their fingers to get an accurately sized ring, later they will also learn how to take sizing from existing rings. They are shown how to use a jeweller’s saw to cut their metal to the correct length, how to form it up and how to solder.

Then they learn how to shape their rings and finish them up into a wearable piece of jewellery, all in the first class!

In the first morning they are also shown how to texture metals, cut and layer shapes, melt balls of silver and other techniques to create decorative elements.

Students can spend their afternoon and evening thinking about and planning their design in silver for the next day. We encourage them to carefully plan this project and think about how they might make their piece before they begin, including creating drawings and notes. (We always say drawings don’t need to be “good”, they just need to make sense to the student and their tutor!). This project can be another ring, or earrings or pendants. We have a great selection of example pieces in the workshop so they can see what’s achievable in the 3 hour time frame. Sometimes students can make more than one silver piece if they have enough time.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, up to 8 grams of sterling silver and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals and chains are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids 12 and up are welcome in this class, any person under 16 years old must be accompanied by an enrolled caregiver.

id: Diesel Jenny x Synthetic Children-Valhalla, 154 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Diesel Jenny x Synthetic Children
venue: Valhalla, 154 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
Two of Aotearoa’s most rungle hardware acts are joining forces for a mid-winter tour across the country this July. Armed with new releases and a reckless lack of MIDI cables, longtime pals Synthetic Children and Diesel Jenny are packing gear into the whip for a trip up and down the motu. The six-date tour will see the pair serve up their respective dishes in Pōneke on Thursday the 17th of July, alongside ethereal favourite Ekho Laliah.

Via hardware synths and drum machines, Synthetic Children (Te Papaioea’s Celina Goacher) is bringing bubbly synths, auto-tuned vulnerabilities, and sub-rattling beats. Her latest Smooch EP, and appearance on the Big Fresh Collective’s Footmahi compilation, show an emerging fun side to her dancefloor arsenal, following the murky weight of 2023’s Everything’s Perpetual. Donnys worldwide have heralded the new release as a “freshly cooked 3 course meal, served up by Palmy’s premier snack pack herself”. Think wonky hyperpop with plenty of low end.

Diesel Jenny’s (Pōneke’s Josh Finegan) live set will blend brain-breaking breaks with sugar-rush synths and 3D club energy years. This tour will celebrate the inaugural release of Diesel Jenny’s white label series with a rock-solid RUC-exempt two-tracker.

With multiple releases on underground mainstays Big Fresh Collective and Bankrupt Records as ABG, this isn’t the first time Diesel Jenny’s revved the engine.

Ekho Laliah is an Aotearoa based artist who stitches together elements of dream pop, freak folk, and ethereal electronica into sonic tapestries with experimental production as the backbone.

Tickets $15 through UTR or $20 at the door

id: The Oscar Garvie Quartet Plays Coltrane-The Rogue and Vagabond, 18 Garrett St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: The Oscar Garvie Quartet Plays Coltrane
venue: The Rogue and Vagabond, 18 Garrett St, Wellington
description:
Join us for a powerful evening of music celebrating the legacy of one of jazz’s most visionary artists — John Coltrane. From his soulful early ballads and hard bop classics to the boundary-pushing spiritual intensity of his later free jazz works, this performance traces the full arc of Coltrane’s musical journey.



Led by drummer Oscar Garvie, the group is anchored by the expressive and deeply studied playing of saxophonist Isaac Randel, whose sound channels the fire and depth of Coltrane’s voice. Randel brings a commanding front-line presence and a profound connection to the material, making him the perfect interpreter of Coltrane’s vast and evolving musical language.



The band also features Jack Harris on bass and Tane Kelly on piano — a dynamic rhythm section that navigates the full emotional and sonic range of Coltrane’s music.



Together, this quartet dives into every era of Coltrane’s work — from the lyrical beauty of Naima and the modal mastery of Impressions, to the raw, transcendent fire of Ascension and Interstellar Space. This tribute isn’t just a look back — it’s a living, breathing expression of what Coltrane’s music still means

Music from 9pm, FREE ENTRY

id: Bailamos Bachata! Latin Dance Party-Southern Cross Garden Bar Restaurant, 39 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Bailamos Bachata! Latin Dance Party
venue: Southern Cross Garden Bar Restaurant, 39 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
(Please note: the event is free but it can only continue if we support the Southern Cross by buying food or drinks)

Wellington’s favourite monthly Bachata Latin dance party!

Join us for an awesome mix of bachata, focusing on the best sensual tracks and remixes, along with salsa and a smattering of kizomba and zouk. We welcome everyone, from the absolute beginner to the most experienced dancer. We’re all about the joy of social dancing together.

And what makes a free party with great people even better? A free beginners’ bachata lesson with some of Wellington‘s best Latin dance teachers. If you’ve never danced bachata, Latin dance or even any other dance style before then this is the perfect lesson for you. We will have you dancing like a pro in no time!

Bailamos Bachata is hosted free of charge by the Southern Cross. They love the atmosphere we bring but we also need to support them in return. We’re asking everyone attending to purchase soft drinks, food or alcohol from the bar. It’s vital we show our gratitude.

1800-1830 social
1830-1900 free lesson
1900-2100 social

What is bachata?
- Bachata is a popular and fun Latin couples dance. It started in the Dominican Republic, then travelled to Europe and the rest of the world. It now includes a wide range of music styles and dance influences and is still changing and evolving.

I haven’t danced before, is that a problem?
- Not at all! That’s exactly what the lesson is for – everyone has to start somewhere and we’re a very welcoming crowd for beginners.

Is bachata a difficult dance to learn?
- Its origins as a party/community dance mean the basics can be learnt quite quickly, so you’ll be enjoying yourself in no time.

Who are the capital bachata collective?
- We are the combined Wellington dance schools and people teaching bachata and we really want to share this dance with everyone. We love bachata, we love our community and we want to share it with you

id: Ōtari Raranga Weavers 2025 Post Matariki Season - Intermediate-Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush, 160 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Ōtari Raranga Weavers 2025 Post Matariki Season - Intermediate
venue: Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush, 160 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington
description:
Ma te mōhio ka roa, ma te ora ka mōhio
Through learning there is life, through life there is learning

Nau mai haere mai, all are welcome to attend Ōtari Raranga Wānanga.

After completing 4 beginner classes (close together) as well as practice at home you may be ready to move up to our intermediate classes. We will work with you to plan the projects you wish to complete and support you to do so. Potential projects can include new closes for your kete timata, kete waikawa, puritanga, pīkau and pōtae. This involves preparation, preservation and storage of harakeke - important especially over winter months.

With regular attendance you will deepen mātauranga gained from beginner classes and share you learnings with others. (Refer to below for a reminder).

What’s included in your intermediate ticket?
- Three hour weaving class with our tuakana weavers and raranga rangatira.
- Limited access to tools as you are expected to be building up your own kete mahi (tool kit).
- You are expected to bring your own harakeke.
- If you are unable to harvest for class, we have ‘Please harvest for me’ options in addition to your ticket at least two days before class.
- Light refreshments are provided and we encourage you to bring kai to share

Led by our raranga Rangatira; Frank Topia (Ngā Puhi, Ngāti Porou, Ngāti Haua) with Linda Lee (Ngāti Huia, Ngāti Raukawa, Ngāti Kurī, Te Rarawa, Te Aupōuri), and Anna Lees (Te Āti Awa, Kāi Tahu). Supported by our kaiāwhina; Anita Murdoch (Ngati Kahungunu and Waikato-Tainui), Sarah O’Sullivan (Ngāi Tahu), Te Kāhui Tapsell (Te Arawa, Tainui), and Frankie Stewart (Tangata Tiriti).

Important information
- It is important that everyone turns up on time for karakia.
- At our discretion tickets are fully refundable or transferable.
- If class numbers are too low, we may have to cancel (and will offer a refund or transfer) so please check your emails before class.
- We offer concession tickets for students, unwaged, seniors, and those with disabilities.
- It is important to us that our classes are accessible to all. If ticket costs are a barrier for you please visit our website to enquire about our reduced cost or free tickets.

Follow us on Facebook or Instagram: Otari Raranga Weavers

For more information about what to expect and what to bring visit our www.otariraranga.co.nz
TICKETING INFORMATION
Tuakana = Older sibling
Intermediate / Tuakana - General Admission: $25
Intermediate / Tuakana - Concession Admission: $20
Intermediate / Tuakana - Koha Admission: $10
Two Class Pass - Two back to back dates only: $45.00

ADD ON - Harvest for me: $20 + eventfinder fees (10 rau only) - 3 days notice required
ADD ON - Harvest for me: $40 + eventfinder fees (20 rau only) - 3 days notice required

Note: Eventfinda fees apply

We mihi to our funders and sponsors Wellington City Council, Wellington Gardens and the Ōtari-Wilton Bush Kaitiaki, Maverick Creative, Good Fortune Coffee and Wellington Apothecary.

With regular attendance you will:
- Learn tikanga (protocols) and karakia for hauhake (harvesting) and preparing harakeke
- Build your mātauranga (knowledge)
- Use kupu Māori appropriate to raranga practice
- Develop your pūkenga (practical skills)
- Create taonga (treasures) for your whānau
- Build hononga (connections) within our raranga rōpū (group)

Donations, Tax Credits and Corporate Gifting
- We accept koha to support Ōtari Raranga Weavers via Shared Lines Trust. This enables us to continue to offer subsidised and free events to the community.
- Shared Lines Trust is registered with Charities Service; Shared Lines Trust (CC61762)
- All donations over $5 made to The Trust are tax-deductible
- For corporate gifting or individuals requesting tax credits please email SharedLinesTrust@gmail.com
- Visit www.sharedlines.org.nz for more information

id: Candidate Information Presentation-Wellington City Council, Room 16.11, Level 16, 113 The Terrace, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Candidate Information Presentation
venue: Wellington City Council, Room 16.11, Level 16, 113 The Terrace, Wellington
description:
Thinking of standing for election? Come along to our candidate information presentation and learn about standing for Mayor, as a Councillor, or as a Community Board Member.

The Wellington City Council Chief Electoral Officer, Warwick Lampp, will be there to explain everything you need to know, including: how the Council is structured, the role and responsibilities of elected representatives, the skills required, anticipated time commitments and meeting schedules, and an overview of the nomination and election process.

If attending in person, please head up to Level 16 and sign in with our receptionist.

The candidate information presentation will also be livestreamed with a New Zealand sign language interpreter on the Wellington City Council YouTube channel. A recording of the presentation will be available to watch later on the Wellington City Council website.

Visit https://wellington.govt.nz/elections for more information for voters and candidates, including nomination forms, key dates, FAQs, ward maps, and details about the Māori ward poll.

id: Intro to Watercolour Painting - 8 week course-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Intro to Watercolour Painting - 8 week course
venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
description:
This class is for anyone interested in making realistic watercolour studies of the world around them.

We will be covering the fundamentals of watercolour: washes, edges, colour theory, composition, tonal value, materials, lighting, subtlety and simplification.

Each week there will be a new still life to work from and artist examples to take inspiration from. Students can also bring along items they would like to paint.

No prior painting experience needed.

In this course you will:

- learn all the basics of watercolour painting.
- discover techniques to manage the paint
- build your confidence to start working on your own projects

You will need to purchase your basic materials for this course and bring them to each class. See materials list below.

Material list for this course is as follows:

- Paper: A4 Hahnemühle Brittania Matt 300g Watercolour Paper, 10 sheet pack, or any watercolour paper. (100% cotton cold-pressed best if budget allows).
- Paint: Pebeo Studio Watercolour Paint 12 colour set, or any watercolour paint. [Need these 6 colours: warm red (e.g., cadmium red), cool red (e.g., alizarin crimson), warm yellow (e.g., cadmium yellow), cool yellow (e.g., lemon yellow), warm blue (e.g., ultramarine), cool blue (e.g., cobalt or prussian). Optional colours: raw sienna, burnt sienna, and viridian].
- Brushes: 1 size 12 round synthetic watercolour brush with a fine tip (e.g., Da Vinci Fit Hobby brush round 373/12 is a good option). [Later on, a brush set is useful: large round (size 20 or 30), medium round (size 10 or 12), small round (size 2 or 3), ½ inch flat brush, size 1 rigger brush, & detail brush size 0].
- Also needed expression folding plastic palette or similar
- Masking Tape Delicate 12mm
- A soft pencil (2B or 4B),
- A kneadable eraser

Inverlochy students get a 10% discount from Gordon Harris art supplies shop. Materials can also be purchased from Spotlight, Whitcoulls, Paper Plus, Warehouse Stationery, Takapuna Art Supplies.

Watercolour shown on website - Magnolia in Glass, Mark Adams, 1979

Thursday mornings, 10 am - 1 pm.
24 July - 11 September.

id: Discover Nonviolent Communication: Expressing Our Needs-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Discover Nonviolent Communication: Expressing Our Needs
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
Discover Nonviolent Communication: Expressing Our Needs
In this introduction to Nonviolent Communication (NVC), we will focus on recognising feelings and needs (our own and others) in order to communicate with more compassion and clarity.

Plus there is an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket!

NVC is a communication framework that offers connection, transparency and understanding. You will get to know some foundational tools of NVC, and practice on examples from real life. This session is interactive, and you will walk away with some understanding of NVC processes and materials to practice in your own time.

You will learn:

what is NVC (Nonviolent Communication)

what are needs and what role they play in communication and life

how feelings are linked with needs

the difference between needs and strategies (and why it matters)

how to listen beyond words and behaviours (your own and others)

Meet your facilitators
Anna Banaś and Helen Williams are passionate, down-to-earth facilitators who bring warmth, depth, and a wealth of experience to their work in Nonviolent Communication (NVC).

Anna is a certified NVC trainer, sociolinguist, and skilled group facilitator who has spent nearly 20 years supporting families, organisations, and communities to communicate with more clarity and compassion. Her background in conflict resolution and deep insight into language and belonging make her teaching both thoughtful and highly practical. Anna is also a parent of three, and brings a beautifully grounded, real-life approach to everything she shares.

Helen brings a rich blend of experience as a mindfulness teacher, mediator, coach, and yoga practitioner. With a background in law and over a decade of running workplace mindfulness programs, she combines clarity with heart. Helen’s training with Dr. Gabor Maté in Compassionate Inquiry adds another powerful layer to her compassionate, trauma-informed approach to communication.

Together, Anna and Helen create a safe, engaging, and supportive space where learning feels both empowering and nourishing. Whether you’re completely new to NVC or looking to deepen your practice, you’ll be in very good hands.

id: Lost Wax in Three Sessions - Hard Wax-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Lost Wax in Three Sessions - Hard Wax
venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
description:
Over three sessions create stunning jewellery using the age-old lost wax technique. This is an excellent opportunity to treat yourself to some creative fun!

This is an excellent opportunity for a best friends' Sunday morning or a self-care session for yourself!

In weeks one and two you'll learn how to work with jeweller's hard wax to create beautiful textures in metal that can be used to create amazing rings or objects. Your waxes will be sent away for casting in the metal of your choice.

Then there’s a week break before the third session, to allow time for everyone's waxes to be cast. The third session covers how to trim, clean and finish your casts, turning them into original jewellery ready to wear!

More advanced students can use these sessions to complete projects in a class setting.

Included in the class fee are all your different types of waxes, sandpaper and courier costs.

Not included are the casting and metal costs which vary from student to student depending on what sized ring they want to make and the type of metal you choose. Small castings can cost around $6.65 - $12 and might cost between $7 to $30 in metals depending on if you use red bronze, white bronze or silver.

This class is great for teens and kids over 12 or so. Anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

id: Creative Writing - A Tasting Plate-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Creative Writing - A Tasting Plate
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Get your creativity flowing by exploring some of the star forms of creative writing, focusing each week on a different area of fiction or creative non-fiction.

How often have you said, ‘I wish I could write’? There are many different kinds of writing. Starting is easy so why not give it a go by joining this creative writing ‘tasting plate’.

Each week we’ll focus on a different area of fiction or creative non-fiction. By the end of the programme, you’ll have tried your hand at writing a short story, a narrative poem, a travel memoir, a personal essay drawing from your life, an interview article, a story for children, a short film script and a piece of historical fiction.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
- Create works of fiction
- Develop creative non-fiction text
- Explore the natural inner spirit of writing
- Discover your unique writer’s voice
- Reflect on your own experiences in writing
- Investigate different writing strategies
- Discover where your personal writing passions sit and what works for you.

Bring pen and paper or a laptop.

This course is designed to help you improve your skills, to develop your unique writer's voice and to encourage you to take risks on the page. It is not a course where you'll be asked to read your work out loud, critique other writers work, or hand in your writing to the tutor. This is a safe place where you will be supported to do what writers do best - write.

id: Ka Mua, Ka Muri: an Introduction-Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Ka Mua, Ka Muri: an Introduction
venue: Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington
description:
Nau mai, haere mai, we are proud to present the Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum Legal Series, an informative lecture series about the purpose, historical significance and ongoing mahi of The Waitangi Tribunal held alongside the exhibition He Kura Toi Tangata: 50 Years of the Waitangi Tribunal, 1975-2025.

In order to understand our future, we must first understand our past. Therefore, we announce with great pleasure that noted historian Dame Claudia Orange DNZM OBE CRSNZ will present our opening lecture in this series, which focuses on the history of Te Tiriti o Waitangi and the Waitangi Tribunal.

Encouraging discussion on the Treaty of Waitangi is a vital part of continuing efforts to fulfil the promise of the 1840 agreement. Dame Claudia argues that a broad public understanding of the changes that have occurred in the Māori–Crown relationship is essential in order for those relationships to grow. She says that an understanding of history is vital, and informed vigilance is necessary.

Tickets are $35 per session, or $25 for students and SuperGold Card holders, and include one drink and light kai. Doors open 5:30pm. The exhibition He Kura Toi Tangata: 50 Years of The Waitangi Tribunal will remain open to view until 8pm.

Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum

Wednesday 6 August | 6pm – 8pm

Tickets $25–$35 | Book tickets: https://bit.ly/4lgFb0F

id: Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell Quintet-The Cavern Club, 22 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell Quintet
venue: The Cavern Club, 22 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
The Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell Quintet is thrilled to be performing at the WJC!

Led by saxophonist Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell, the group features Henry Sherris on trumpet —
reuniting after a five-year break during which Henry honed his craft in New York. The two first
played together as teenagers in the Young Musicians Program under the mentorship of the
legendary Rodger Fox, and now return to the stage for this special performance.

Joining them are Callum Allardice on guitar, Seth Boy on bass, and Abe Baillie on drums — an
exceptional rhythm section known for their deep musical connection and expressive interplay.

The quintet will perform a dynamic mix of original jazz compositions. Each piece reflects
moments from Nicholas’s recent journey — from touring internationally with the Rodger Fox Big
Band to day-to-day insights gained through his work as a teacher. The set will also feature
compositions by Henry, offering reflections on his time living and studying in New York.

This concert marks a meaningful farewell before Nicholas heads to Amsterdam to begin the
next chapter of his musical journey. Don’t miss the chance to experience this heartfelt
performance live.

id: Pocket Shrine Workshop-Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Pocket Shrine Workshop
venue: Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington
description:
Join us for a relaxed, drop-in style workshop where you’ll craft your own pocket shrine. These miniature altars are made inside small tins and can be dedicated to someone or something meaningful to you. It could be in memory of a loved one, in honour of a favourite artist, pet, place, or even a whimsical nod to the faeries. Anything goes.

Pocket shrines are designed to be carried with you or kept close. You might keep yours on your desk, in your bag, or tucked in your pocket to bring comfort, inspiration, or connection wherever you go.

We’ll have everything you need to bring your shrine to life, including collage materials, fabric scraps, buttons, beads, and more. If you’d like to make a shrine in memory of someone special, you are welcome to bring a small photo of them to include.

This event is part of Takurua Hauora: Winter Wellness, a Wellington event series promoting health and wellbeing inspired by Sir Mason Durie’s Whare Tapa Whā model.

Suitable for ages 12+.

id: The Inner Magnet – Manifesting from the Inside Out-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: The Inner Magnet – Manifesting from the Inside Out
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars

The Inner Magnet – Manifesting from the Inside Out

Why do some desires seem to flow effortlessly into our lives, while others feel blocked at every turn? What if the key to manifestation isn’t about effort, but alignment?

This workshop explores how the wisdom of yoga philosophy can help us shift from the noise of a reactive, conditioned mind into a space of deeper inner alignment. Beyond just rewiring thoughts, yoga offers a map back to the part of us that is steady, clear, and deeply connected — an inner magnet that draws what is truly nourishing for our growth and transformation.

Through reflection, and an informed practice, you’ll be invited to consider how tuning inwards can begin to shape your outer reality in more meaningful ways. Whether you're new to yoga philosophy or have walked this path for a while, this session offers a grounded and enriching perspective on the subtle art of manifestation.

Meet your host, Rasesvari
Rasesvari is an events co-ordinator who loves to bring people together and create a warm and memorable experience. She thrives on connection with others and has a deep desire for a lifestyle of yoga, meditation and holistic healing.

id: Conscious Connected Breathwork Immersion: Release, Reset & Realign-Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington-Event Finder

venue: Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington
description:
If you’ve been stuck in your head, second-guessing, holding it all together - this is your invitation to let it all go.

You weren’t made to play small. You were made to feel free, powerful, and wildly connected to yourself. This session is about coming back to your truth, reclaiming your spark & putting full trust in the beautiful way your life is unfolding.

What is Conscious Connected Breathwork?
It’s a powerful somatic (body-based) practice using a slow circular breath pattern to move stagnant energy, release stored emotion, and tap into clarity, safety and deeper connection. It’s simple, potent, and deeply transformative.

Think: therapy meets meditation meets energetic upgrade!

• Release stuck energy, stress, and emotional weight
• Move through big feelings instead of spiraling in them
• Drop into your body like it’s home again
• Soften fear and reconnect with deep inner trust
• Reignite your fire + right to take up space
• Unravel old stories and remember your power
• Learn how breath rewires patterns + unlocks your truth
• Leave clearer, braver, and more fully alive

We’ll begin with cacao, grounding practices, and a Breathwork intro, before guided Breathwork, a lush sound bath for integration, space to anchor the shifts, and tea & snacks. You'll also receive my Post-Breathwork Care Guide and a personal follow-up from me to support your process.

No experience needed – just curiosity and an open mind.

Any questions, reach out!

https://linktr.ee/heyhailey_nz
hailey@heyhailey.co.nz
www.heyhailey.co.nz

id: Conservation Kōrero: Talk Toitoi To Me-ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Conservation Kōrero: Talk Toitoi To Me
venue: ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington
description:
They may be little fish in a big pond, but their growing impact has been sending ripples across Zealandia Te Māra a Tāne.

Toitoi, or common bully, have been translocated across three years from Kohangapiripiri near the Pencarrow Lighthouse to the Roto Māhanga/Upper Reservoir in Zealandia. An endearing little ika, these fish are now thriving at Zealandia, being spotted along Te Māhanga stream, in Roto Kawau/Lower Reservoir, and downstream beyond the fence!

Central to the kaupapa of this project was ongoing improvements to translocating the fish as we worked with mana whenua to incorporate traditional mātauranga Māori methods, and now together we want to share the whole story with you.

Join us for our next Conservation Kōrero, where a panel of participants in the toitoi translocations from 2023-2025 share the development of the translocations and the discoveries we made along the way.

This event will be held in the Pāteke Room in the Visitor Centre with light refreshments provided. Doors open at 5.45pm, parking is available at both our Visitor Centre and overflow parking area on Birdwood Street.

id: NZSO Firebird: Ravel & Stravinsky-Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Wakefield Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: NZSO Firebird: Ravel & Stravinsky
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Wakefield Street, Wellington
description:
J Ritchie Papanui Road Concert Overture
de Falla Nights in the Gardens of Spain
Ravel Piano Concerto in G Major
Stravinsky Suite from The Firebird (1945 version)

Spanish pianist Javier Perianes, able to “make the piano sing and glitter with alert, polished brilliance” (Sydney Morning Herald), joins us for two virtuoso masterworks. Ravel’s Piano Concerto in G explores both Ravel’s Spanish Basque roots and the enlivening rhythms of jazz, while de Falla’s portrait of Andalusian Spain is darker, dramatic, and seductive. Meanwhile, Stravinsky’s Firebird conjures images of the magical glowing bird of Russian myth, but John Ritchie brings us back to earth with the clanging tramcar bell and 1950s hustle of Christchurch’s Papanui Road.

Leading our tour of these pictorial works is Winner of the Finnish critics’ prize 2021 for the Best Newcomer in the Arts, Emilia Hoving. “Hoving is a conductor on the rise, and for good reason. She has a highly precise, refined and inventive conducting technique that combines airy breathability with power” (Turku Sanomat).

name: Before We Slip Beneath the Sea
venue: Wairarapa Events Centre, Holloway St, Carterton
description:
An immersive theatrical experience, brought to you by Red Scare Theatre Company.

On a small island off Wellington’s north coast, the local community have gathered for the last time in the wake of an impending evacuation due to rising sea levels. When one community member decides to take a stand against the evacuation, the community is divided, long-buried tensions come to the fore, and everyone must decide how to cope with change, loss and forces far greater than themselves.

“A hauntingly beautiful portrayal of human relationships. It’s a fantastic immersive experience that plunges you into the sea of its drama, and you don’t even really want to come up for air.” - Elliot Lam, Wellyott

Winner of Best Play by a Woman Playwright and overall Runner-Up at the 2024 Adam NZ Play Awards.

STARRING:
Charlie Potter, Hannah McKenzie Doornebosch, Craig Geenty, Megan Connolly, Helen Jones, Billie Deganutti and Ralph Johnson.

WRITTEN AND DIRECTED BY:
Cassandra Tse.

id: Padi Rescue Diver Course-New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
name: Padi Rescue Diver Course
venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana
description:
CHALLENGING And REWARDING - The BEST Dive Course You Will EVER Take…
These words probably best describe the PADI Rescue Diver course. Building upon what you’ve already learned during your diving to date, this course expands your knowledge and prepares you to deal with any problems you may encounter, on and under the water.

The Rescue Diver course is the perfect opportunity for you to develop your personal self-rescue dive skills, help tired divers, administer first aid and rescue distressed divers, under the guidance of your PADI Instructor.

During the online theory you’ll learn how to think like a rescue diver and preview skills you’ll practice with your PADI Instructor. After you have completed the Rescue Diver theory online, you come in and spend a weekend with us practicing the skills and concepts you learnt about, first in the pool then out in the ocean in progressively more challenging situations. We also take you through the Medic First Aid practical if you don’t already have a first aid and CPR certificate.

The Rescue Diver will start you looking differently at diving, being more aware of the divers around you as well your own safety and dive gear. It is a prerequisite for the Master Scuba Diver Rating (the most prestigious recreational rating) as well as the Divemaster program (the first step in the professional dive ratings). It is commonly viewed as the most important dive course people take.

PADI Rescue Diver Course Information:
Digital Theory – PADI Rescue Diver eLearning or tablet course (about 11 hours)
Full Weekend – Practical rescue skills and scenarios in the pool and open water

Prerequisites:
PADI Advanced Open Water Diver certification or Adventure Diver with Navigation (or qualifying certification from another agency)
12 Years of age or older

What To Bring:
Diver Medical | Participant Questionnaire (completed in the last 12 months). Other languages – click here
Your PADI Advanced Open Water Diver card or Adventure Diver with Navigation
Your eLearning completion form
First Aid & CPR certificate (can be taught in conjunction with the course)
Swimming costume and towel, plus your dive gear. Hire gear available as needed.

Costs:
Full Course Fee: $499 (book with a friend and get $20 off!)
Includes; PADI eLearning Course and Rescue Diver Quick Review & Practical Sections.
If you need a First Aid & CPR certificate, the Medic First Aid course, purchased with the Rescue Diver Course is only $150 (normally $185).

When:
Course times are 8.30am to approximately 4:30pm. Courses are normally once every 3 months through-out the year or by demand.
One-off mid-week courses by arrangement, conditions apply.

id: 200 Hour Vinyasa Yoga Teacher Training-Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington-Event Finder
name: 200 Hour Vinyasa Yoga Teacher Training
venue: Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington
description:
AWHI Yoga and Wellbeing’s accredited 200hr YTT program is a comprehensive and thorough journey into becoming a 200 hr certified Yoga Teacher. We are the only vinyasa yoga teacher training in the world that blends Te Ao Māori and ancient yoga wisdoms, offering a uniquely 'Aotearoa' experience while retaining universal relevance for teaching and practicing yoga in any part of the world.

Our training is suitable for individuals interested in becoming a yoga teacher, or those looking to take a personal journey towards deepening your own practice and knowledge. Either way, we guarantee a transformative and life-changing experience that will deepen your relationship to yoga, others, Aotearoa and your self.

Our uniquely Aotearoa Teacher Training explores the beautiful marriage between ancient Yoga and Te Ao Māori teachings over five separate modules during our three months together. Our course follows the Māori hauora/wellbeing model of Te Whare Tapa Whā, which takes the same holistic view of health taken by traditional Yoga. As we work through each pillar we start tapping into something way greater than ourselves, enabling us to connect with our purpose in life and how we might share this in service to the world!

A $1,000 deposit reserves your spot.

id: Habits Mastery Series: Mindset Reset - Rewire Your Thinking for Growth-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Habits Mastery Series: Mindset Reset - Rewire Your Thinking for Growth
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars

Feel stuck in the same patterns, even when you're trying to change?
It’s not a lack of motivation. It’s not a lack of willpower.
It’s a mindset that doesn't serve your purpose.

Join us for the next workshop in our Habits Mastery Series:

In this interactive 1-hour workshop, you’ll learn:

How your beliefs shape your habits and outcomes

The difference between a fixed and growth mindset

How to shift your internal dialogue and self-image

Tools to break limiting beliefs and unlock your potential

“Whether you think you can, or you think you can’t — you’re right.”
— Henry Ford

Walk away with practical tools, inspiring insights, and the motivation to think bigger about your life.

Meet your host, Nava

Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After four exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!

id: Otis Prescott-Mason, Solo Piano-St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Otis Prescott-Mason, Solo Piano
venue: St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington
description:
Otis Prescott-Mason is a pianist from Wellington and a current classical performance student at Victoria University of Wellington's New Zealand School of Music. He currently studies under Dr. Jian Liu and Professor Boris Berman.

In 2022 Otis was awarded 1st prize, Best Performance of a Classical Sonata, and the Audience Choice Award at the Lewis Eady National Piano Competition. In the same year he was awarded 1st prize at the PACANZ National Piano Competition. Otis was also awarded 1st prize at the 2020 New Zealand Junior Piano Competition.

Otis is a grateful recipient of generous support from Professor Jack Richards and the Royal Over-Seas League which assists him to perform and study in Europe and the United States of America.

Programme:

Schubert - Impromptu in Gb major, Op. 90 No.3
Schubert - Sonata in G major, D.894

id: Restore Your Core Method 6 Week Course-Newtown Community Centre/Te Whare Hapori o , Corner Rintoul & Colombo Streets, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Restore Your Core Method 6 Week Course
venue: Newtown Community Centre/Te Whare Hapori o , Corner Rintoul & Colombo Streets, Wellington
description:
The Restore Your Core® method is a comprehensive exercise program created for women who have core and pelvic floor dysfunction.

Issues like:
- leaking urine when running, sneezing, jumping, coughing
- constant back pain
- a weak core or a gap in the core wall (diastasis recti)
- a bulging sensation in the pelvic floor
- hip discomfort
- painful intercourse
- pelvic organ prolapse

Combining sustainable and functional yoga and Pilates-based exercises with the fundamentals of biomechanics, the Restore Your Core® method takes a unique approach to core wellness, aiming to empower and educate women for the long term by teaching them how to move efficiently and exercise optimally.

With its unique tools, terminology and cues, this exercise program teaches the principles of core engagement and strengthening in a way that is accessible, unambiguous and clear. It takes a function-over-fit approach and encourages women to return to the activities they love once they feel ready and confident. It offers long term solutions over quick-fix ones.

The six week course will build knowledge and skills week on week. The class is limited to ten people to allow for individual attention and each week you be given homework to consolidate the practice. The course is $100 and takes place at Newtown Community Centre on Mondays 7:30-8:30pm July 14th - Aug 18th.

If you're not sure if it's right for you, you can take advantage of a free 15 minute consultation call. You may also wish to consider a private class beforehand to understand the unique aspects of your movement so you can take the maximum the benefits from the course.
The course, private classes and free consultations can be booked at coreandmore.co.nz.

id: Troy Roberts Masterclass-Bedlam and Squalor, Upstairs, 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Troy Roberts Masterclass
venue: Bedlam and Squalor, Upstairs, 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
This afternoon is a rare opportunity to catch internationally renowned saxophonist, Troy Roberts presenting a masterclass on topics including improvisation, approaching standards, and a discussion of a life in jazz.

The New York City based Australian immigrant is a prolific leader with sixteen releases to his name. Currently celebrating his latest, Green Lights (featuring John Patitucci, Paul Bollenback and Jimmy Macbride), Roberts maintains a busy recording and performance schedule with his quartet, his original project Nu-Jive, as well as some of the greatest artists of today. Embracing his love for a vast variety of stylistic genres, the three-time GRAMMY nominated saxophonist is quickly becoming one of the most widely recorded touring artists of his time. As a go-to first call saxophonist, his name adorns several essential recordings ranging from the legendary Joey DeFrancesco, the iconic Van Morrison, the quintessential Jeff "Tain" Watts, the tireless Orrin Evans Captain Black Big Band, the critically acclaimed Kurt Elling, the breathtaking Veronica Swift, to numerous other jazz veterans, and newcomers considered tastemakers of their generation.

At 7pm Troy will be performing with Wellington-based artists Duncan Haynes (piano), Seth Boy (acoustic bass), and Mark Lockett (drums).
General admission concert only $30. Student concert only tickets (with Student ID) at the door $20.

The Fareham property has extensive grounds which include a historic homestead, farmland, established organic gardens and an orchard, old school buildings, a swimming pool, and an arts community on site.

id: Future Focussed Leadership – Leading Teams Into Tomorrow-ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Future Focussed Leadership – Leading Teams Into Tomorrow
venue: ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington
description:
Join the IML community in Wellington for an inspiring event set in the breathtaking surrounds of Zealandia Wildlife Sanctuary, which will feature an exclusive presentation with CEO Dr Danielle Shanahan, who will share her extraordinary insights on sustainability, future readiness, and building resilience.

Dr Shannahan will draw on inspiration from nature to explore practical strategies for navigating common challenges faced by many managers and leaders today, including maintaining engagement and motivation without financial incentives and the importance of clear communication, shared purpose, deep passion and adaptive leadership to create long-term success.

Whether you’re a seasoned executive or an emerging leader, this session is your opportunity to gain fresh insights, sharpen your leadership edge and connect with members of IML and the broader Wellington leadership community.

We look forward to seeing you there!

id: The Marriage Course-Heretaunga Community Church, 51 Lane Street, Upper Hutt-Event Finder
name: The Marriage Course
venue: Heretaunga Community Church, 51 Lane Street, Upper Hutt
description:
The Marriage Course is for all couples, whether you've been together for 1 year or 51 years! Whether you have a strong relationship that you want to make even better or one that could do with a little help. There's always something that you can learn that will make your relationship stronger.

Each evening starts with a romantic candlelit dinner together in a relaxing atmosphere. Then there is a talk on a specific subject, interspersed with film clips of couples sharing their own experiences and street interviews with people from around the world. The sessions feature regular breaks for the couple to chat about the topics. Couples sit at their own table and talk only to each other – there is never any group work. The topics covered include:

-Strengthening connection
-Communicate more effectively
-Resolving conflict
-Heal the ways you’ve hurt each other
-Recognise how your upbringing affects your relationship
-Improve relationships with parents and in-laws
-Develop greater sexual intimacy
-Discover each other’s love languages and much, much more!

The course runs for 7 sessions, starting at 7:00pm and finishing at 9:30pm. Dinner is provided so you just need to turn up and enjoy spending time together while investing in your relationship.

id: Psychology of Money Management-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Psychology of Money Management
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
"Everything starts with awareness and a good plan." This isn't your typical financial budgeting session where I tell you to stop buying coffee. It's about understanding the psychology behind how you spend or save, and discovering how we can make preparing for our future easier and more enjoyable. Once you understand how you regard money, you can take control of yours!

Managing finances should be empowering and enjoyable, yet traditional methods often make money a stressful, taboo topic—even with your closest loved ones. In this workshop, we're not here to tell you to cut your budget or skip your favourite treats. Instead, we’ll come together to design a financial plan tailored to your unique needs, making you feel confident, excited, and in control.

In this workshop, you’ll explore the psychology of money and how it influences your financial decisions. Through real-life case studies, step-by-step guidance, and collaborative exercises, you’ll design a financial system that suits your lifestyle, reduces stress, and helps you achieve your goals.

If you want to simplify your finances and live without the worry of every dollar spent, then this is the workshop for you!

NOTE: This course is subsidised with funding from the Tertiary Education Commission (TEC) and you must provide photo ID when you attend your first session, if applicable.

Disclaimer: The tutor is not a financial advisor. No investments, products nor specific recommendations will be provided. A step-by-step planning process will be taught by working through a case study. Any product names or websites used in examples and explanations to help participants understand financial concepts and the planning process are used for clarity only. They are not given as any type of recommendation.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: Troy Roberts Quartet-Bedlam and Squalor, Upstairs, 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Troy Roberts Quartet
venue: Bedlam and Squalor, Upstairs, 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
WJC is excited to announce a special one-off concert featuring Grammy nominated saxophonist, Troy Roberts.

Embracing his love for a vast variety of stylistic genres, three-time GRAMMY nominated saxophonist, Troy Roberts is quickly becoming one of the most widely recorded touring artists of his time. As a go-to first call saxophonist, his name adorns several essential recordings ranging from the legendary Joey DeFrancesco, the iconic Van Morrison, the quintessential Jeff "Tain" Watts, the tireless Orrin Evans’ Captain Black Big Band, the critically acclaimed Kurt Elling, the breathtaking Veronica Swift, including numerous other jazz veterans, and newcomers considered tastemakers of their generation.

The New York City based Australian immigrant is also a prolific leader with sixteen releases to his name. Currently celebrating his latest, Green Lights (featuring John Patitucci, Paul Bollenback and Jimmy Macbride), Roberts maintains a busy recording and performance schedule with his quartet, his original project Nu-Jive, as well as some of the greatest artists of today. With a busy international schedule, it is not often that Roberts finds time to schedule NZ dates, so this show is not to be missed!

Joining Troy Roberts (tenor saxophone), Duncan Haynes (piano), Seth Boy (acoustic bass), Mark Lockett (drums).

Troy Roberts continues to be a master of styles and configurations with this eminently accessible, sonically and rhythmically engaging session, emitting steam and sumptuous harmonic colors along the way. -Glide Magazine

Tickets are also available on Eventfinda and at the door for a masterclass by Troy Roberts at Bedlam & Squalor on 2 August at 4pm.

id: Writing A Novel-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Writing A Novel
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Kick start your novel in this series of weekly workshops with practical writing exercises which will build ideas, form the raw material of your book and get you started.

Description
An introductory course for those keen to start writing a novel.

By the end of the course, you'll be able to:
- Generate ideas for writing your novel
- Create convincing characters
- Write compelling dialogue
- Develop a strong structure for your story
- Follow the process towards completing your first draft

Bring pen and paper.

This course is designed to help you improve your skills, to develop your unique writer's voice and to encourage you to take risks on the page. It is not a course where you'll be asked to read your work out loud, critique other writers' work, or hand in your writing to the tutor. This is a safe place where you will be supported to do what writers do best - write.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. id: Glass Bead-Making Taster-Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki-Event Finder
name: Glass Bead-Making Taster
venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
description:
Join us for this fabulous introduction to working with colourful molten glass!

This class is a great way for absolute beginners to get a taste of working with glass to produce beautiful beads that can be used in a myriad of ways, including making a unique gift for your loved one (or yourself!).

As one of the earliest forms of human adornment, beads have long functioned as a way to express individuality, and what better way to do that than to learn to make your own unique beads?

Students are shown correct lampworking techniques to produce several decorative beads in just 3 hours! How many beads you make is up to you, some students make up to 10 while others make fewer using trickier techniques.

Kids over 12 (or so) are welcome to take the class but anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

id: Contemporary Realism - 8 Week Painting Course-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Contemporary Realism - 8 Week Painting Course
venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
description:
Whether you work from objects, the figure, or secondary sources, this is an opportunity to explore working more loosely, using oils or acrylics.

Experienced tutor, Justine Turnbull, will guide you through drawing and painting exercises to help loosen you up, and will discuss art historical techniques that may be relevant to your individual artistic style and context.

This course will increase your ability to represent perceived objects in a dynamic, painterly way. You will be guided through drawing and painting exercises to help you achieve accuracy of form, working loosely with oils and acrylics to create fresh contemporary paintings. The emphasis is on working with your chosen source material to create a `next level’ painting. This course is for those who have explored some of the basics of painting such as mixing colours, blending etc, but want to find a process that best expresses your unique approach and ideas. Skills learnt in class can be applied across all genres.

Materials are not included in this course.
Materials: Please bring your preferred range of oils, brushes and supports (paper, canvas, or board). A good basic set of oil paints would include cad and lemon yellow, ultramarine and cerulean blue, and cad red and alizarin crimson. Also, black and white. Inverlochy will supply Liquin and odourless turps. Please also bring a photocopied reference image in both black and white and colour.

Lunch break - 30 minutes. Bring a water bottle and packed lunch to enjoy in the historic Inverlochy House or explore the local cafes in Te Aro.

Thursdays, 9:30 - 3 pm.
24 July - 11 September.

id: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression-Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington-Event Finder
name: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression
venue: Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington
description:
Any woman in Wellington is welcome to attend our regular meetings which have been running for the past 15 years.

There is a wide spectrum of experience of depression in the group - from very mild to more severe. Some people may have experienced depression in the past and come along to help manage relapses. It is a very diverse group and ranges in number from week to week - from 3 to 14 people.

It is a friendly and non-threatening environment and most newcomers find it to be very welcoming and inclusive. ThroughBlue is not affiliated with any religious organisation or church. You are welcome to participate as much as you wish in terms of talking about your experience or to sit and observe without having to say anything, depending on what suits you. There is a structure to the meetings, with a new topic each week.

The group is facilitated by professional counsellors. We ask for a donation of $10 waged and $5 unwaged per meeting to cover food and go towards some of the venues hire costs.

What is the structure of group meetings?
- 12:30pm - Meditative grounding exercise
- 12:40pm - Opening round – how was your week, a highlight, did you achieve your goal or anything else you’d like to say
- 1:30pm - Tea break (about 10 minutes)
- 1:40pm - Educational topic
- 2:20pm - Closing round - what you found useful, something you are looking forward to this week, possibility to set a goal for the week to come.
- 2:30pm - Finish

id: The Bitter Brothers Come Home-Vogelmorn Bowling Club, 93 Mornington Road, Brooklyn, Wellington-Event Finder

venue: Vogelmorn Bowling Club, 93 Mornington Road, Brooklyn, Wellington
description:
The Bitter Brothers are coming home! After winding our way around the North Island in Holly Jean’s Estima, trailer in tow, from club to club in a jam-packed tour promoting our recent debut album, Daddy Was An Outlaw, we are very excited to bring it all back home and close off our tour full circle with a big party at the Voglemorn Upstairs! We have some old favorites, some new numbers lined up for you all, and some very special surprise quests who you won’t want to miss.

And if you haven’t heard about us by now, The Bitter Brothers are a five-piece, Wellington based, southern gothic, old-time, alt-folk, alt-country musical experience. They have banjos, accordions, violins, various guitars and voices, upright basses, drums, percussions, delightfully unexpected arrangements, tempos, and smile-inducing harmonies. The Bitter Brothers bring it all and invite you along for the ride!

id: Intro to 2D Traditional Animation - 8 Session Evening Course-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Intro to 2D Traditional Animation - 8 Session Evening Course
venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
description:
This is a beginners course in 2D animation where you'll learn the time-honoured principles of hand-drawn animation and how to apply them to your own animation project. You may work on a project incorporating your own ideas, or if you'd rather, an assigned a project from your tutor.

You can use any device, ipad or laptop you already own (except a mobile – it's really not big enough to do good animation on). The school does not provide any digital equipment.

Your tutor, Ross Payne, is a 30 year veteran of traditional 2D animation, and loves to share his knowledge about it for you to love it as much as he does.

In each lesson there will be examples and demonstrations of the animation principles with follow up exercises to put your new skills into practice. You'll work on your project both during class and at home, applying the animation principles to your individualised project.

You can choose to draw your animation on paper then scan/capture into your device, or choose to draw your animation digitally, directly into an animation programme. which ever you choose, instructions in class will be provided to give you the skills needed for this step.

Ross will advice you on the a variety of animation apps/programmes available online to use, ranging in price from free to not very much.

Note - A computer mouse can be used for 2D animation but digital pens are much easier to use. Prior to the course commencing, you'll receive details of recommended programmes to use for the course.

Tuesday evenings, 6:30 - 8:30 pm.
22 July - 9 September.

id: Painting In Oils - Eight Week Course-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder

venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
description:
This class is open to all levels of students interested in exploring the possibilities of this traditional medium. The main exercises will be based on a still life, however students are free to explore subjects of their choice.

This course focuses on the technique of oil painting. You will learn to:

- Choose a colour palette
- Choose and prepare supports on which to paint on with oils
- Create a composition according to the subject selected
- Learn how to render volume and form
- Learn expressive qualities of colour and brushwork
- Students will also learn to stretch their own canvas

If you want to explore the possibilities of painting in oils then this is the course for you.

Tuesday mornings, 10 am - 1 pm. 22 July - 9 September.

id: Inspired: Using Notion for Mindful Productivity-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Inspired: Using Notion for Mindful Productivity
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
Inspired: Using Notion for Mindful Productivity

What if your to-do list felt as nourishing as your breathwork practice?

This is the perfect 60-minute live workshop where Elebreath®️ meets mindful systems—a space to organize your life and business without slipping into hustle mode. We’ll blend somatic awareness with Notion, the all-in-one tool I use to manage my energy, organize my mind, and create with more ease.

Plus - there’s an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert after your event. All included in the ticket price!

This isn’t just about getting things done. It’s about doing it from a regulated, resourced place—so your nervous system feels held every step of the way.

Perfect for:
Soulful entrepreneurs, wellness professionals, creatives, and high-performers craving structure without burnout.

What You’ll Learn:

How your nervous system influences focus, clarity, and creative flow

How I integrate Elebreath®️ to map my energy before taking action

The exact Notion system I use to track tasks, brain dumps, and flow states

How to design a dashboard that moves with your body, not against it

You’ll Walk Away With:

A fully set-up Notion workspace that mirrors your calmest, clearest self

A Daily Flow Tracker + Brain Dump Inbox to release the mental clutter

Tools to show up consistently—even on low-energy days

Included in your ticket:

Lifetime access to the free resources like: guided breathwork, fatigue guide, and many more

My Notion templates & tracker bundle

Bonus PDF: Nervous-System Safe Productivity Rituals

An amazing plant-based dinner & dessert!

This is productivity with breath, intention, and soul.
Come as you are. Leave with clarity, calm, and a system that works with you.

Meet Lynn, your host

Lynn supports visionaries, wellness practitioners, and purpose-driven creatives to return to their bodies, unlock their energetic potential, and grow businesses that feel deeply aligned and regenerative.

Her approach weaves together somatic healing and conscious entrepreneurship—blending breathwork, trauma-informed nervous system care, yogic wisdom, and energetic mastery into my signature modality, Elebreath®️. It’s more than a method—it’s a remembrance of your most embodied, empowered self.

Alongside this deep inner work, Lynn guides Soulful Notion®️ Workshops—where nervous system regulation meets mindful productivity. Using Notion as a soul-aligned system, we co-create space for structure, ease, and clarity—so you can live and work in a way that honors your energy.

Whether you're seeking deeper purpose, more sustainable flow, or a business that mirrors your dharma—my work is here to support your return to truth, breath by breath.

Because success rooted in soul and body is the kind that actually lasts.

Check out Lynn on her Instagram and website

description:
A course for beginners where we'll cover clay preparation through to throwing of basic forms. All materials provided. (Held at Wellington Potters' Centre, 130 Grant Road, Thorndon).

Pottery - Throwing: Beginners

This is an introduction to the wonderful, organic material that is clay. You'll receive a comprehensive overview to working with clay which will cover all steps from clay preparation and re-cycling through to glazing the finished work. You'll learn to throw basic forms with group demonstration and one-to-one instruction.

Pottery courses are held at Wellington Potters' Association, 130 Grant Road, Thorndon. All our courses are scheduled up to a year in advance which means the at times we may need to make changes to the original schedule. Please make sure you check your emails regularly in case of any changes.

All materials included in course fee. For more information about Wellington Potters, click on this link.

By the end of the course, you'll be able to:
- Wedge and re-cycle clay
- Demonstrate the basics of working on a pottery wheel
- Centre clay on the wheel
- Open a centred piece of clay on wheel
- Pull clay up to form basic beaker/cylinder shape
- Demonstrate the correct use of prepared glazes

id: Acing The Interview-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Acing The Interview
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Are low confidence, anxiety and your lack of interview experience, getting in the road of you succeeding in getting offered jobs? Get practical, cutting-edge tools and techniques to Ace your interview!

Description
People have skills which they want to offer to employers, however, low confidence and anxiety combined with a lack of interview experience results in them not gaining employment.

'Acing The Interview' is a 3-module one day workshop that provides practical, cutting-edge tools and techniques to prepare participants to 'Ace the Interview'.

The 3 modules are:

1. Resourceful You - Think
2. Managing You - Feel
3. Acing the Interview - Do

Explore how to manage your thoughts under pressure and control your critical voice. Understand how to manage anxiety and stress. Demonstrate your interview skills and use body language and well-formed responses to create a powerful and positive first impression.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:

- Manage your thoughts and critical voice under pressure
- Visualise and mentally rehearse for success
- Recognise your emotional reactions and manage your emotions under pressure
- Utilise techniques to manage anxiety
- Demonstrate interview skills and deliver well-formed responses to questions
- Understand the star model and other communication techniques and how and when to use them

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: Revelation Valley-BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Revelation Valley
venue: BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington
description:
Experience the artistry of theatre-maker Lisa Maule and special guests in this poetry premiere.

---
Three years ago surrounded by books and thinking about constitutional change, Pākehā theatre maker Lisa Maule decided to write poetry. "Revelation Valley" is a selection of her writing performed by Lisa with titles such as My Capitalist Stapler, Cohesion is Also a Radical Act and Is it Hate? (a poem about love).

Each night a different invited guest adds to the creativity with a taste of their own work. Guests are Dylan Fa'atui, Eru Moriarty, Aische Arawelo, Jim Moriarty, and Heather Came. The show also features music collaboration with Michelle Scullion.

Embrace unexpected laughs, challenge your norms and immerse yourself in creativity.

"Not a straight town at all, not a straight down. An asphalt zigzag.
Home to hydrangea’s, cats, rats, cars, tartan trinkets, china tea cups
and
traces
of
ancient trees."
(Lisa Maule)

---
Lisa Maule grew up in Wellington where she was born and went to Karori Normal School and Wellington Girls College. Her heritage is English and Scottish. She has two young adult children and two black fluffy dogs. As a theatre maker Lisa started in the 1990s, her first role outside of university was as the technical operator at BATS Theatre on a Red Mole show. Other formative experiences were at Taki Rua Theatre and with women's theatre such as Not Broadcast Quality and Magdalena Aotearoa. She is Producer / Kaihautū at the Maori theatre company Te Rākau Hua o Te Wao Tapu working alongside Jim Moriarty and Helen Pearse-Otene

The creative practice Lisa is best known for is her lighting design work and she also loves to draw, paint and make collage. Lisa has a penchant for collecting chairs and she is good at cutting cardboard.

name: Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing
Slow down, settle in, and let the soft glow of the moon guide you inward.

This calming evening will centre around the deeply restorative practice of Yoga Nidra—a guided meditation designed to bring your body into a state of deep rest while your awareness gently drifts between waking and dreaming. Known to activate the parasympathetic nervous system and reduce stress, Yoga Nidra supports emotional balance, mental clarity, and a profound sense of ease.

This moon-themed session invites you to tune into the gentle, reflective energy of the lunar cycle—a time for slowing down, softening, and simply being.

After the practice, we’ll be sharing a nourishing plant-based dinner together. It’s included in your ticket and is a lovely way to gently transition back, connect, and enjoy wholesome food in good company.

Meet Karuna, your host
Trained as a primary school teacher, she also has a background in psychology and Spanish. But her heart is in connecting with others and she always brings a lively and warm energy to the space.
